subject: Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-06-03 18:42:33.000000000', 'message': "Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 and reno 3.1.0 versions. Using
these versions will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Disable openstackdocs_auto_name to use 'project' variable as name.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: I704d232c38e9d4073514ceb3d13b15400f478182
"}]
commit_message:
Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 and reno 3.1.0 versions. Using
these versions will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Disable openstackdocs_auto_name to use 'project' variable as name.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: I704d232c38e9d4073514ceb3d13b15400f478182

commit_message:
Fix missing output call

The ok signal was not properly using the same output function as the
rest so when we added timestamps these lines were missed.

Change-Id: I945fb6f058cbb1614714e86cbe5ce44abbefb0c8
(cherry picked from commit 0778316f65c3047623a1e5727a310b4e353b5137)

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-05-11 14:03:24.000000000', 'message': 'Remove newline from default public_net_name

The public network name is set via public_net_name, and its default
value is the first item in the external_net_names list. The variable
uses the YAML folded block scalar notation, but does not use the
chomping indictator, which means the string is assigned a trailing
newline.

This change fixes the issue by adding the chomping indicator.

Change-Id: I68fb65cd3bc7c4390813747f9ac4ecebc3b4145f
Story: 2007654
Task: 39731
'}]
commit_message:
Remove newline from default public_net_name

The public network name is set via public_net_name, and its default
value is the first item in the external_net_names list. The variable
uses the YAML folded block scalar notation, but does not use the
chomping indictator, which means the string is assigned a trailing
newline.

This change fixes the issue by adding the chomping indicator.

Change-Id: I68fb65cd3bc7c4390813747f9ac4ecebc3b4145f
Story: 2007654
Task: 39731

commit_message:
Return an empty string if relation data is missing

None is returned for a relation data value if a key isn't present -
assuming that it's a string is not correct. This change fixes that by
returning an empty string if protocol-name is not present.

Change-Id: I2bab6a69f9f663edee0738ff35b804d81736cb5c
Closes-Bug: #1882084

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-10-11 18:29:49.000000000', 'message': 'Add `get_node_network_data` method to NetworkInterface

Extends NetworkInterface with `get_node_network_data` method
providing network configuration for node NICs in form of Nova network
metadata structure (i.e. `network_data.json`). Network interface
implementations would implement their own ways of gathering network
configuration when possible.

Ironic would eventually pass network configuration to the node being
managed out-of-band.

Change-Id: I4c956c08a695fb17ec32c3e2a17cbca55148eb79
Story: 2006691
Task: 36992

commit_message:
Add `get_node_network_data` method to NetworkInterface

Extends NetworkInterface with `get_node_network_data` method
providing network configuration for node NICs in form of Nova network
metadata structure (i.e. `network_data.json`). Network interface
implementations would implement their own ways of gathering network
configuration when possible.

Ironic would eventually pass network configuration to the node being
managed out-of-band.

Change-Id: I4c956c08a695fb17ec32c3e2a17cbca55148eb79
Story: 2006691
Task: 36992

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2019-12-10 17:07:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

(6 comments)

we don't have to do anything with PUT (or if-match) because we already allow clients to send quoted or unquoted with those ops.

So is this ready to go?"}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2019-12-10 18:14:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

(8 comments)

We *do* have to touch PUT -- it emits an ETag for what was just uploaded. Fortunately, the gatekeeper change doesn't look at request method at all :-D

> So is this ready to go?

No; as you pointed out, a whole bunch of func tests fail with this turned on. I've got some changes locally to fix some of them; still have ~15 failures I need to deal with. Will try to have something actually ready to merge later today.

Note that I'm not entirely sure that I like the gatekeeper growing more options like this -- it feels like some not-insignificant scope creep. I originally *wanted* to do this in the proxy-server app, but then it wouldn't work with encryption turned on..."}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2019-12-10 21:24:38.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2019-12-10 23:49:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-11-20 05:26:21.000000000', 'message': 'WIP: Add proxy-server option to quote-wrap all ETags

Change-Id: I984ab8d1304d23b89589973950b10dda4aea0db3
'}, {'created': '2019-11-20 17:23:51.000000000', 'message': 'WIP: Add proxy-server option to quote-wrap all ETags

Change-Id: I984ab8d1304d23b89589973950b10dda4aea0db3
'}, {'created': '2019-12-09 19:19:19.000000000', 'message': 'WIP: Add proxy-server option to quote-wrap all ETags

Change-Id: I984ab8d1304d23b89589973950b10dda4aea0db3
'}, {'created': '2019-12-10 21:24:38.000000000', 'message': 'Add proxy-server option to quote-wrap all ETags

Users have complained for a while that Swift's ETags don't match the
expected RFC formats. We've resisted fixing this for just as long,
worrying that the fix would break innumerable clients that expect the
value to be a hex-encoded MD5 digest and *nothing else*.

Let's turn it over to operators to decide what will work best *for
them*. Add a new config option to the gatekeeper, `quote_etags`. It
defaults to false, but when enabled will ensure all emitted ETags match
either the "strong" or W/"weak" formats specified in RFCs 2616 and 7232.

Note that if a middleware such as DLO, SLO, or s3api was *already*
quoting the ETag, it will not be modified.

See also:
  - https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc2616#section-3.11
  - https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7232#section-2.3

Closes-Bug: 1099087
Closes-Bug: 1424614
Change-Id: I984ab8d1304d23b89589973950b10dda4aea0db3
'}, {'created': '2019-12-11 00:31:34.000000000', 'message': 'Add proxy-server option to quote-wrap all ETags

Users have complained for a while that Swift's ETags don't match the
expected RFC formats. We've resisted fixing this for just as long,
worrying that the fix would break innumerable clients that expect the
value to be a hex-encoded MD5 digest and *nothing else*.

Let's turn it over to operators to decide what will work best *for
them*. Add a new config option to the gatekeeper, `quote_etags`. It
defaults to false, but when enabled will ensure all emitted ETags match
either the "strong" or W/"weak" formats specified in RFCs 2616 and 7232.

Note that if a middleware such as DLO, SLO, or s3api was *already*
quoting the ETag, it will not be modified.

See also:
  - https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc2616#section-3.11
  - https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7232#section-2.3

Closes-Bug: 1099087
Closes-Bug: 1424614
Change-Id: I984ab8d1304d23b89589973950b10dda4aea0db3

We don't use them. Let's stop caring about them more officially.

Note that some of the initially proposed repos have *not* been retired,
so their jobs are added back in here. The repos are

commit_message:
Finish retiring unused puppet modules

We don't use them. Let's stop caring about them more officially.

This retires the following repositories:
    opendev/puppet-accessbot
    opendev/puppet-ansible
    opendev/puppet-cgit
    opendev/puppet-drupal
    opendev/puppet-etherpad_lite
    opendev/puppet-exim
    opendev/puppet-gerrit
    opendev/puppet-gerritbot
    opendev/puppet-github
    opendev/puppet-infracloud
    opendev/puppet-ipsilon
    opendev/puppet-iptables
    opendev/puppet-os_client_config
    opendev/puppet-packagekit
    opendev/puppet-phabricator
    opendev/puppet-snmpd

Note that some of the initially proposed repos have *not* been retired,
so their jobs are added back in here. The repos are
opendev/puppet-{jenkins,nodepool,openstackci,zuul}.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/720892

commit_message:
Remove undercloud_enable_paunch option

undercloud_enable_paunch isn't needed anymore since we retire Paunch
project.

There is no need of deprecating the option since it would have no effect
if set in undercloud.conf.

Change-Id: I9972d3e9826422cd6ab56c801ff93c4d2dfc8404

commit_message:
Switch to tripleo stdout callback

In order to improve the UX and prevent confusion during the async status
output, we need to write a custom callback to change the text.

See See also https://github.com/ansible/ansible/issues/63926

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/732924
Change-Id: Ie3021ddfe1b4ca304cfd34a46fd4e4c7e9c62e9f
(cherry picked from commit b3c87dda237fe28465a02b900a9ab360af384aa9)

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-05-30 14:20:08.000000000', 'message': "Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 and reno 3.1.0 versions. Using
these versions will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Disable openstackdocs_auto_name to use 'project' variable as name.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: I7f4ca3a53f5f6266e525d9430d79c0bcee359477
"}, {'created': '2020-06-02 08:55:09.000000000', 'message': "Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 and reno 3.1.0 versions. Using
these versions will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Disable openstackdocs_auto_name to use 'project' variable as name.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Add docs building job so that this can merge.

Change-Id: I7f4ca3a53f5f6266e525d9430d79c0bcee359477
"}]
commit_message:
Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 and reno 3.1.0 versions. Using
these versions will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Disable openstackdocs_auto_name to use 'project' variable as name.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Add docs building job so that this can merge.

Change-Id: I7f4ca3a53f5f6266e525d9430d79c0bcee359477

commit_message:
Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 and reno 3.1.0 versions. Using
these versions will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

Set openstackdocs_auto_name to use 'project' as name.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/729744
Change-Id: Id3989cabdbf2204821531b00149aa0f1cb8a4955

commit_message:
Cleanup py27 support

This repo is now testing only with Python 3, so let's make
a few cleanups:
- Remove python 2.7 stanza from setup.py
- Add requires on python >= 3.6 to setup.cfg so that pypi and pip
  know about the requirement
- Remove obsolete sections from setup.cfg
- Update classifiers
- Remove install_command from tox.ini, the default is fine,
  move constraints into deps
- Remove releasenotes tox environment, this repo has no releasenotes
- Use hacking instead of flake8 in test-requirements
- Use TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE, UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE is obsolete
- Switch to Py38, as this is newest version used in openstack

Change-Id: I43ce6f290f80b10426bdb1520a43284bf1dc1ab7

commit_message:
Redo release schedules, include 20.08 + 20.10

The 'list-tables' method for table creation is the
preferred upstream method for documentation. The
tables for 20.08 and 20.10 did not use this method
as it cannot accommodate row-spanning, which was
required.

Change-Id: Idcd0ad4e833c3f122dd479a639299db0b7da1c86

commit_message:
Default facility to None in OSJournalHandler class

Use a default value of None for facility in OSJournalHandler
class, as is done in the OSSysLogHandler class.

Neutron started failing with a:

 E1120: No value for argument 'facility' in constructor call

With a recent release of oslo.log.

Change-Id: I5269b82d219fd2377535120d9d266238d50431b3
Related-Bug: #1871840
(cherry picked from commit 184235c26517598d6e60f4db72e095ba061a0d6e)
(cherry picked from commit c77f3c9aa82364c482be9b37e6d29634273bb90f)
(cherry picked from commit e19c4076b1f0d7fdbd6d68a09c973934029926a1)

[{'created': '2020-05-13 02:08:17.000000000', 'message': 'Fix hacking min version to 3.0.1

flake8 new release 3.8.0 added new checks and gate pep8
job start failing. hacking 3.0.1 fix the pinning of flake8 to
avoid bringing in a new version with new checks.

Though it is fixed in latest hacking but 2.0 and 3.0 has cap for
flake8 as <4.0.0 which mean flake8 new version 3.9.0 can also
break the pep8 job if new check are added.

To avoid similar gate break in future, we need to bump the hacking min
version.

- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014828.html

Change-Id: Idd108d9575b276f3d78a7c3c6dbc5f3ed3205411

Also removing the hacking and other related dep from lower-constraints file

commit_message:
Fix hacking min version to 3.0.1

flake8 new release 3.8.0 added new checks and gate pep8
job start failing. hacking 3.0.1 fix the pinning of flake8 to
avoid bringing in a new version with new checks.

Though it is fixed in latest hacking but 2.0 and 3.0 has cap for
flake8 as <4.0.0 which mean flake8 new version 3.9.0 can also
break the pep8 job if new check are added.

To avoid similar gate break in future, we need to bump the hacking min
version.

Also removing the hacking and other related dep from lower-constraints file
as theose are blacklisted requirements and does not need to be present
there.

- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014828.html

Change-Id: Idd108d9575b276f3d78a7c3c6dbc5f3ed3205411

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: Iac415cd5bd7346847edeb174b059ffbc3e2a1bdf
"}]
commit_message:
Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 and reno 3.1.0 versions. Using
these versions will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Disable openstackdocs_auto_name to use 'project' variable as name.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: Iac415cd5bd7346847edeb174b059ffbc3e2a1bdf

commit_message:
Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 and reno 3.1.0 versions. Using
these versions will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Set openstackdocs_pdf_link to link to PDF file. Note that
the link to the published document only works on docs.openstack.org
where the PDF file is placed in the top-level html directory. The
site-preview places the PDF in a pdf directory.

Set openstackdocs_auto_name to use 'project' as name.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always
used 'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx'
can lead to some strange rendering.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the
renames before the next release removes them. A couple of variables
are also not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: I5db2dc63ea51f0005aa1244b5b9c692ec23ce314

subject: Cap jsonschema 3.2.0 as the minimal version
messages: [{'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2020-05-26 20:13:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 27224, 'date': '2020-06-04 22:06:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 22998, 'date': '2020-06-05 16:46:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1\n\nThanks'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-05-26 20:13:11.000000000', 'message': "Cap jsonschema 3.2.0 as the minimal version

Previous versions of jsonschema (<3.2.0) doesn't support python 3.8 [1].
Python 3.8 is part of the victoria supported runtimes [2] so we now force
to use jsonschema version 3.2.0 to avoid issues, remove ambiguity and ensure
that everything works with python 3 in general.

[1] https://github.com/Julian/jsonschema/pull/627
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/victoria.html#python-runtimes-for-victoria

Change-Id: Icacc6d338703ec27cb6a867ef5708ee58f949bbe
"}]
commit_message:
Cap jsonschema 3.2.0 as the minimal version

Previous versions of jsonschema (<3.2.0) doesn't support python 3.8 [1].
Python 3.8 is part of the victoria supported runtimes [2] so we now force
to use jsonschema version 3.2.0 to avoid issues, remove ambiguity and ensure
that everything works with python 3 in general.

[1] https://github.com/Julian/jsonschema/pull/627
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/victoria.html#python-runtimes-for-victoria

Change-Id: Icacc6d338703ec27cb6a867ef5708ee58f949bbe

a few cleanups:

- Update classifiers

  move constraints into deps

  remove babel.cfg likewise

- update hacking to version 3.0

Change-Id: Ibcb7be4fd057b24147b7b562302ea362ad8c71b3

commit_message:
Cleanup py27 support

This repo is now testing only with Python 3, so let's make
a few cleanups:
- Remove python 2.7 stanza from setup.py
- Remove obsolete sections from setup.cfg
- Update classifiers
- Use newer openstackdocstheme and Sphinx versions
- Remove install_command from tox.ini, the default is fine;
  move constraints into deps
- Remove Babel from requirements, it's not needed for running;
  remove babel.cfg likewise
- Use TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE, UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE is obsolete
- update hacking to version 3.0

Change-Id: Ibcb7be4fd057b24147b7b562302ea362ad8c71b3

commit_message:
CI: reduce memory and disk for testing nodes

There is not reason to use 10 or 12G of disk for Cirros.

Also change the RAM to 512M, although we'll have to revert it back
on master and ussuri once we switch to DIB images by default.

Conflicts:
	scripts/test-bifrost.sh

Change-Id: Ibada78686ffb4db1d8dae05acf980081d5265fc6
(cherry picked from commit 85e1b8207885d64daf986158dba8768ae49b257e)

commit_message:
Remove VxFlex OS credentials from connection_properties

VxFlex OS password is not stored in block_device_mapping table. Instead of this
passwords are stored in separate file and are retrieved during each attach/detach
operation.

Closes-Bug: #1823200
Change-Id: I3f6bfe360491c295bdb81008c31ad2d4e3305736

commit_message:
Add tripleo container image hotfix command

This change adds a CLI command to invoke hotfixes via the TripleO modify
image role. This CLI command will ensure a uniform experience for operators
when needing to apply a hotfixes to containers.

Change-Id: I364fb42a41b4cb4ae076f07704c72c6ea442a198
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3153, 'name': 'Emilien Macchi', 'email': 'emilien@redhat.com', 'username': 'emilienm'}, {'_account_id': 14985, 'name': 'Alex Schultz', 'email': 'aschultz@next-development.com', 'username': 'mwhahaha'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23181, 'name': 'RDO Third Party CI', 'email': 'dmsimard+rdothirdparty@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdothirdparty', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 28522, 'name': 'Hervé Beraud', 'email': 'herveberaud.pro@gmail.com', 'username': 'hberaud'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-06-03 18:35:14.000000000', 'message': "Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 and reno 3.1.0 versions. Using
these versions will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: I9aaeff342fe7fad68d05acb4843ba371f47d8af4
"}]
commit_message:
Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 and reno 3.1.0 versions. Using
these versions will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: I9aaeff342fe7fad68d05acb4843ba371f47d8af4

commit_message:
Fix api.pp "Unknown variable"

When running, we get:
Unknown variable: '::placement::params::api_package_name'.
Indeed, the variable should be ::placement::params::package_name.

This patch fixes this.

Change-Id: I764ee3a47edc5b2d40ed1870bcb94ada3ed9ef38
(cherry picked from commit 142633cc5861694b7385f755024172b5d7ab032f)

commit_message:
Retire more opendev puppet modules

Start retiring opendev/puppet-{accessbot,ansible,drupal,snmpd}
repositories, add noop-jobs.

See also

commit_message:
Refactor placement::api

This patch refactors placement::api class with generic_service class
to make service/package management more simple.

Note that it also fixes incorrect stop of httpd service on non-Debian
system.

Change-Id: I152fb025027480a4a5151d5372dd03618c482b95

commit_message:
Pin telemetry-tempest-plugin to 0.4.0 for python2 compatibility.

OSA deploys Stein under python2 and 0.4.0 is the last relases of the
telemetry tempest plugin that supports pyhton2.7. Pin the version
of the plugin to 0.4.0.

Change-Id: Ie3e62f169210647210358487c2e81afe8c269bf4

commit_message:
Refactor placement::api

This patch refactors placement::api class with generic_service class
to make service/package management more simple.

Note that it also fixes incorrect stop of httpd service on non-Debian
system.

Backport note:
This backports doesn't include deprecation part because we shouldn't
deprecate parameteres in stable branches.

Change-Id: I152fb025027480a4a5151d5372dd03618c482b95
(cherry picked from commit 425180f5b8789852cba3511e16218fcb9c4607e2)

commit_message:
DNM: remove salt tracking from requirements

salt is only used in heat-agents and only in testing.  It has long interfered
with updating other libraries (msgpack for instance). version 3001 may fix this
or not, we'll see in a couple of weeks.

Change-Id: I3cb83ce348f6cfd118e7b0cbdf4bd8d70044d78b

subject: Enable 'data' LVM group only for Docker devicemapper
messages: [{'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2020-04-23 13:21:23.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2020-04-23 19:57:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:\n\nrecheck'}, {'account_id': 28048, 'date': '2020-06-05 09:38:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 15197, 'date': '2020-06-05 13:12:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-23 13:21:23.000000000', 'message': "Enable 'data' LVM group only for Docker devicemapper

This change is a precursor to switching the default Docker storage
driver to overlay2.

Previously, Kayobe's default configuration included a 'data' LVM volume
group, with a 'docker-volumes' logical volume mounted at
/var/lib/docker/volumes. Additionally, if the Docker devicemapper
storage driver was used, the data volume group would contain the
docker-thinpool and docker-thinpoolmeta volumes.

This LVM setup was really included for devicemapper, and while in some
cases it may be useful to have docker volumes as a separate logical
volume, this doesn't really make sense as a default. Often in
environments using other Docker storage drivers, the data volume group
would be removed from configuration.

This change modifies the default LVM configuration to only create a
'data' volume group if the Docker storage driver is devicemapper.
Additionally, new flags are added to make this choice independent from
the storage driver, to support cases where the data volume group is
required without devicemapper.

Change-Id: Ia3c1f6423c32fa2580b57db32512a34ce35d7acc
Story: 2005667
Task: 30973
"}]
commit_message:
Enable 'data' LVM group only for Docker devicemapper

This change is a precursor to switching the default Docker storage
driver to overlay2.

Previously, Kayobe's default configuration included a 'data' LVM volume
group, with a 'docker-volumes' logical volume mounted at
/var/lib/docker/volumes. Additionally, if the Docker devicemapper
storage driver was used, the data volume group would contain the
docker-thinpool and docker-thinpoolmeta volumes.

This LVM setup was really included for devicemapper, and while in some
cases it may be useful to have docker volumes as a separate logical
volume, this doesn't really make sense as a default. Often in
environments using other Docker storage drivers, the data volume group
would be removed from configuration.

This change modifies the default LVM configuration to only create a
'data' volume group if the Docker storage driver is devicemapper.
Additionally, new flags are added to make this choice independent from
the storage driver, to support cases where the data volume group is
required without devicemapper.

Change-Id: Ia3c1f6423c32fa2580b57db32512a34ce35d7acc
Story: 2005667
Task: 30973

commit_message:
Remove VxFlex OS credentials from connection_properties

VxFlex OS password is not stored in block_device_mapping table. Instead of this
passwords are stored in separate file and are retrieved during each attach/detach
operation.

Closes-Bug: #1823200
Change-Id: Ie9c41f37ab5c186b9f9aa92539a363d0b2388035

[{'created': '2020-05-28 18:33:48.000000000', 'message': 'Install libselinux-python on Ansible control host

Certain Kolla Ansible tasks need access to the Python SELinux module. On
the Ansible control host, this module is symlinked into the
kolla-ansible virtualenv. The libselinux-python module needs to be
installed for this to succeed. Typically this is the case, but in some
environments it is not. This affects the kayobe control host bootstrap
command:

TASK [kolla-ansible : Ensure selinux Python package is linked into the
virtualenv]

not exist, use \"force=yes\" if you really want to create the link:
/usr/lib64/python2.7/site-packages/selinux", "path":
"/home/centos/kolla-venv/lib/python2.7/site-packages/selinux",
"src": "/usr/lib64/python2.7/site-packages/selinux"}

This change fixes the issue by installing libselinux-python on Python 2
based systems.

Story: 2007703

'}]
commit_message:
Install libselinux-python on Ansible control host

Certain Kolla Ansible tasks need access to the Python SELinux module. On
the Ansible control host, this module is symlinked into the
kolla-ansible virtualenv. The libselinux-python module needs to be
installed for this to succeed. Typically this is the case, but in some
environments it is not. This affects the kayobe control host bootstrap
command:

TASK [kolla-ansible : Ensure selinux Python package is linked into the
virtualenv]
fatal: [localhost]: FAILED! => {"changed": false, "msg": "src file does
not exist, use \"force=yes\" if you really want to create the link:
/usr/lib64/python2.7/site-packages/selinux", "path":
"/home/centos/kolla-venv/lib/python2.7/site-packages/selinux",
"src": "/usr/lib64/python2.7/site-packages/selinux"}

This change fixes the issue by installing libselinux-python on Python 2
based systems.

Change-Id: Id1dfdfa6a597d89c42acfdd7350e16332a397083
Story: 2007703
Task: 39819

commit_message:
Switch to using virtual envs by default

They're already used in the CI, and chances are high that non-venv installation
is broken on at least some supported systems.

subject: Do not install redhat-rpm-config
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 7118, 'name': 'Ian Wienand', 'email': 'iwienand@redhat.com', 'username': 'iwienand'}, {'_account_id': 10118, 'name': 'IBM PowerKVM CI', 'email': 'kvmpower@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powerkvm', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23181, 'name': 'RDO Third Party CI', 'email': 'dmsimard+rdothirdparty@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdothirdparty', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 6469, 'date': '2019-08-09 08:06:32.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2019-08-12 04:24:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I'm a little worried on this one; it's not clear to me it has been fixed.

I think that https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1218294 is basically the problem; that python was built with the hardening flags that require the macros etc in this package, and then when they were not there pip installs tried to build with these flags and failed.  and then i think there was some push-back about making redhat-rpm-config a dependency of python-devel for the same reasons as here, in that it dragged in other stuff.

I *think* that this was resolved with

https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/Changes/Python_Extension_Flags

(from https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1217376) which looks like it might only be F30+?"}, {'account_id': 6469, 'date': '2020-06-05 14:34:18.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-09 08:06:32.000000000', 'message': "Do not install redhat-rpm-config

Package redhat-rpm-config was added in Change-Id
I459f2203fa145049dda185da952813118193d573 to fix a problem of gcc
requiring files provided by redhat-rpm-config on Fedora 21. This issue
might have been fixed in the last 4 years.

This patch removes redhat-rpm-config as there's no value in having it
on yum-minmal environments, and it pulls Perl and its subpackages.

Change-Id: I80d08fb56698228393d2b19b0ffc3720ff5fdebb
"}]
commit_message:
Do not install redhat-rpm-config

Package redhat-rpm-config was added in Change-Id
I459f2203fa145049dda185da952813118193d573 to fix a problem of gcc
requiring files provided by redhat-rpm-config on Fedora 21. This issue
might have been fixed in the last 4 years.

This patch removes redhat-rpm-config as there's no value in having it
on yum-minmal environments, and it pulls Perl and its subpackages.

Change-Id: I80d08fb56698228393d2b19b0ffc3720ff5fdebb

commit_message:
Add backup/restore configuration secret

This patchset adds a secret containing the backup/restore configuration
for Postgresql, in case it is needed for invoking a backup/restore
operation from a different application or from a different namespace
(like from a utility container). Default is to not produce the secret.

Change-Id: I273fe169e7ee533c3fe04ad33c97af64b29bc16f

commit_message:
Fix listener stats and amp health DB deadlock

Similar to what was observed in story 2005893 and fixed in
I20572505e448f9b7ff6314b5167cc4c519c445fb, a DBDeadLock was also
observed when updating the health of an amphora.

http://logs.openstack.org/51/618751/13/check/ \
kuryr-kubernetes-tempest-openshift/49a4d64/controller/ \
logs/screen-o-hm.txt.gz?level=ERROR

This patch adds deadlock retry wrapper to the listener stats and amphora
health replace methods.

Task: 34773
Story: 2006060

Change-Id: I323ca1a136c45d1fb629156d4ed54824cf64feac

commit_message:
Read current domain state from XML on filesystem

Use the XML file as a source of truth when getting current
state of each domain. Reading current state from the running
VM's requires that we do a reboot every time we change something.

Change-Id: Ifcc9afc46562a5df5dd73010b8d274452c1aefc1
Story: #2007735
Task: #39901

subject: Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-06-03 18:38:40.000000000', 'message': "Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 and reno 3.1.0 versions. Using
these versions will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: I2cad15084abecd4592bb0a2b6d22a75f5713d027
"}]
commit_message:
Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 and reno 3.1.0 versions. Using
these versions will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: I2cad15084abecd4592bb0a2b6d22a75f5713d027

commit_message:
Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 and reno 3.1.0 versions. Using
these versions will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: I7160d8874ddc504bca5463776ee4b2ed66d0bfb4

commit_message:
Update OVN metadata agent binary name

During the transition from networking-ovn to the neutron tree, the name
of the metadata agent binary changed from networking-ovn-metadata-agent to
neutron-ovn-metadata-agent. This patch updates the service definition to
allow the metadata agent to function.

Change-Id: I69a4e5deed4b21e70afd7dac747375b81e98cb22

commit_message:
Switch to newer openstackdocstheme version

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 version. Using
this version will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-03 16:31:04.000000000', 'message': 'Use Ansible connection reset support in docker role

When configuring Docker we need to kill persistent SSH connections to
refresh the membership of the docker group for the stack user. Currently
we are using a fairly heavy handed method of removing all ControlPersist
sockets because the Ansible reset_connection meta module previously did
not work [1]. This issue is fixed since Ansible 2.5.6.

This change switches to the reset_connection meta module, which now
works as expected.

[1] https://github.com/ansible/ansible/issues/27520

Change-Id: Id4d951e447720e1d769491c0d34ad83099c030eb
'}]
commit_message:
Use Ansible connection reset support in docker role

When configuring Docker we need to kill persistent SSH connections to
refresh the membership of the docker group for the stack user. Currently
we are using a fairly heavy handed method of removing all ControlPersist
sockets because the Ansible reset_connection meta module previously did
not work [1]. This issue is fixed since Ansible 2.5.6.

This change switches to the reset_connection meta module, which now
works as expected.

[1] https://github.com/ansible/ansible/issues/27520

Change-Id: Id4d951e447720e1d769491c0d34ad83099c030eb

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-05-29 13:23:11.000000000', 'message': "Fix external API interface with out an IP address

Steps to reproduce:

* Define a separate network for the external API network
* Don't define a cidr field for the new network (prevents IPs being
  allocated to hosts on this network)
* Set the vip_address field for the network (and optionally fqdn)
* kayobe overcloud host configure
* kayobe overcloud service deploy
* kayobe overcloud host configure (again)

On the final command, keepalived will have created a VIP on the
interface, causing the command to fail with an error like the following:

    Interface eth0 has an IPv4 address but none was requested

This change fixes the issue by passing the VIP address as an allowed
address to the MichaelRigart.interfaces role. This depends on
https://github.com/michaelrigart/ansible-role-interfaces/pull/71.

Change-Id: Ic86c0ca1b8209c968cb20a11bb3f40da71f296d0
Story: 2007736
Task: 39902

commit_message:
Fix external API interface with out an IP address

Steps to reproduce:

* Define a separate network for the external API network
* Don't define a cidr field for the new network (prevents IPs being
  allocated to hosts on this network)
* Set the vip_address field for the network (and optionally fqdn)
* kayobe overcloud host configure
* kayobe overcloud service deploy
* kayobe overcloud host configure (again)

On the final command, keepalived will have created a VIP on the
interface, causing the command to fail with an error like the following:

    Interface eth0 has an IPv4 address but none was requested

This change fixes the issue by passing the VIP address as an allowed
address to the MichaelRigart.interfaces role. This depends on
https://github.com/michaelrigart/ansible-role-interfaces/pull/71.

Change-Id: Ic86c0ca1b8209c968cb20a11bb3f40da71f296d0
Story: 2007736
Task: 39902

subject: Handle degoverned teams in highlights extension
messages: [{'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2020-06-04 19:05:53.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2020-06-05 13:11:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1\n\nThis is blocking everything and is a simple fix, so I'm going to push it through. Feel free to revert and/or update if any issues are found."}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-06-04 19:05:53.000000000', 'message': 'Handle degoverned teams in highlights extension

The highlights extension attempted to be helpful by pulling in team
details from governance into the generated highlights output. This did
not account for the possiblity that teams may actually leave official
OpenStack governance, and therefore may not have these details present
in the governance output.

This adds handling to fail gracefully in this scenario by just not
trying to include the information that is no longer there.

Change-Id: Iee97b9547a2044acd86864f788f7ba1294afbf0a
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Handle degoverned teams in highlights extension

The highlights extension attempted to be helpful by pulling in team
details from governance into the generated highlights output. This did
not account for the possiblity that teams may actually leave official
OpenStack governance, and therefore may not have these details present
in the governance output.

This adds handling to fail gracefully in this scenario by just not
trying to include the information that is no longer there.

Change-Id: Iee97b9547a2044acd86864f788f7ba1294afbf0a
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

Add operator for tripleo container image build

This new operator will allow to build TripleO container images using the
v2 interface in tripleoclient.

commit_message:
Default facility to None in OSJournalHandler class

Use a default value of None for facility in OSJournalHandler
class, as is done in the OSSysLogHandler class.

Neutron started failing with a:

 E1120: No value for argument 'facility' in constructor call

With a recent release of oslo.log.

Change-Id: I5269b82d219fd2377535120d9d266238d50431b3
Related-Bug: #1871840
(cherry picked from commit 184235c26517598d6e60f4db72e095ba061a0d6e)
(cherry picked from commit c77f3c9aa82364c482be9b37e6d29634273bb90f)

There is a help button in horizon dashboard that has various
use cases:

- by default it should point to upstream documentation;

commit_message:
Add an option to adjust help URL in horizon

There is a help button in horizon dashboard that has various
use cases:

- by default it should point to upstream documentation;
- OpenStack vendor could adjust this URL, so it will point
  to his documentation;
- every cloud operator could adjust this URL, so users will
  be re-directed to some custom portal.

This patch adds an option to configure custom URL for Help
button using HorizonHelpURL parameter.

Change-Id: Ic95e55a007ea6db9336e81574c7a49185590eaee
Closes-Bug: #1879522
Related: rhbz#1835820

Moving to ansible 2.9

Some code changes were necessary since the Ansible-provided jinja tests
as filters was removed in ansible 2.9, see [1]

Co-authored-by: Kaio Oliveira <kaio.kassiano.oliveira@gmail.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-06-02 12:23:52.000000000', 'message': "Switch to newer openstackdocstheme version

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 version. Using
this version will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Disable openstackdocs_auto_name to use 'project' variable as name.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: I04809a3cbfaaea711509f4a16548e4813780ddfc
"}]
commit_message:
Switch to newer openstackdocstheme version

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 version. Using
this version will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Disable openstackdocs_auto_name to use 'project' variable as name.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: I04809a3cbfaaea711509f4a16548e4813780ddfc

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-06-02 17:11:02.000000000', 'message': "Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 and reno 3.1.0 versions. Using
these versions will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Set openstackdocs_pdf_link to link to PDF file. Note that
the link to the published document only works on docs.openstack.org
where the PDF file is placed in the top-level html directory. The
site-preview places the PDF in a pdf directory.

Disable openstackdocs_auto_name to use 'project' variable as name.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: Ia39d9da11dacaff56c97367a30c0ace7385c7128

commit_message:
Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 and reno 3.1.0 versions. Using
these versions will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Set openstackdocs_pdf_link to link to PDF file. Note that
the link to the published document only works on docs.openstack.org
where the PDF file is placed in the top-level html directory. The
site-preview places the PDF in a pdf directory.

Disable openstackdocs_auto_name to use 'project' variable as name.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: Ia39d9da11dacaff56c97367a30c0ace7385c7128

[{'created': '2020-06-05 09:43:54.000000000', 'message': 'Drop hard requirement on debootstrap and EPEL

EPEL is only needed for debootstrap, debootstrap is only needed when
building Debian/Ubuntu images. Install it on demand and update the docs.

Change-Id: I6b90c91f20b5acd198cabbb89f21a72caaf90c63
(cherry picked from commit 7e363d431890ead1582a09e1b61cadb575e35c82)
'}]
commit_message:
Drop hard requirement on debootstrap and EPEL

EPEL is only needed for debootstrap, debootstrap is only needed when
building Debian/Ubuntu images. Install it on demand and update the docs.

Change-Id: I6b90c91f20b5acd198cabbb89f21a72caaf90c63
(cherry picked from commit 7e363d431890ead1582a09e1b61cadb575e35c82)

this version will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: Id95a6d2403c03cb909a37820f07d28107c5b02b2

CentOS 8 does not have uWSGI, not even in EPEL:

commit_message:
Install uWSGI from PyPI to repair CentOS 8 support

CentOS 8 does not have uWSGI, not even in EPEL:
https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1757157

Since it's installable from PyPI, let's do it instead.
Also update SELinux to enable uWSGI+nginx to operate.

Change-Id: I44d0582e221e24404f427b261bf6d366f5c32775
(cherry picked from commit 8593f2378b4955ea117813b6db8374a09746565c)

commit_message:
Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 and reno 3.1.0 versions. Using
these versions will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Set openstackdocs_pdf_link to link to PDF file. Note that
the link to the published document only works on docs.openstack.org
where the PDF file is placed in the top-level html directory. The
site-preview places the PDF in a pdf directory.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: Iebfa30b3545bab9eb568ac30f9296ba51b4ba6c8

commit_message:
If the "[conductor]XXX_timeout" is less than 0，disable periodic task

"[conductor]clean_callback_timeout"，"[conductor]inspect_wait_timeout"
and "[conductor]inspect_wait_timeout" are a negative value will cause
an error on start up from now on.

Change-Id: Id3bef9a753be7f0c468ea3033698f0e9cd276a64
Story: 2007600
Task: 39576

[{'created': '2020-05-29 09:41:22.000000000', 'message': 'Support QoS by meter action

Currently, QoS is implemented by TC command of HV OS.
This solution has many drawbacks, such as not supported
VLAN network or VMs from same HV.

Meter is a comfortable solution, because it is implemented
in OpenFlow, so it is flexible and exact.

Conflicts:
	networking_ovn/common/ovn_client.py

Change-Id: I2373a81ca2c5d6616c0097f15dd59327116db93f
Closes-Bug: #1850609
(cherry picked from commit e7df3706043df6d117758547cf6e41f8d097af14)

commit_message:
Support QoS by meter action

Currently, QoS is implemented by TC command of HV OS.
This solution has many drawbacks, such as not supported
VLAN network or VMs from same HV.

Meter is a comfortable solution, because it is implemented
in OpenFlow, so it is flexible and exact.

Conflicts:
	networking_ovn/common/ovn_client.py

Change-Id: I2373a81ca2c5d6616c0097f15dd59327116db93f
Closes-Bug: #1850609
(cherry picked from commit e7df3706043df6d117758547cf6e41f8d097af14)
(cherry picked from commit f21d4d5b34438f3e164e5963e5799256c8bfae4f)

subject: Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions
messages: [{'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2020-06-03 16:19:12.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2020-06-03 17:25:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 28619, 'date': '2020-06-05 11:27:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 25023, 'date': '2020-06-05 11:50:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-06-03 16:19:12.000000000', 'message': 'Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 and reno 3.1.0 versions. Using
these versions will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Set openstackdocs_pdf_link to link to PDF file. Note that
the link to the published document only works on docs.openstack.org
where the PDF file is placed in the top-level html directory. The
site-preview places the PDF in a pdf directory.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also

commit_message:
Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 and reno 3.1.0 versions. Using
these versions will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Set openstackdocs_pdf_link to link to PDF file. Note that
the link to the published document only works on docs.openstack.org
where the PDF file is placed in the top-level html directory. The
site-preview places the PDF in a pdf directory.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: I125fc53d6f30fa72e6814526080b79264eb6bf55

commit_message:
Set disable_dnsmasq_dns to True

We don't use its DNS capabilities, and leaving DNS enabled conflicts
with the local resolved on at least Bionic.

Story: #2007691
Task: #39834
Change-Id: I1ebd51a9414bb9686aa92376b34f38c029846c07
(cherry picked from commit b86f4782284417d6745fde107f90fe6ddce17412)

commit_message:
Use unittest.mock instead of third party mock

Now that we no longer support py27, we can use the standard library
unittest.mock module instead of the third party mock lib.

Change-Id: I12e1a2a4a22116cabd09a3b808f871d98e4bd1f2
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Use newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions

The sync from https://review.opendev.org/733244 updated to
openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 and reno 3.1.0 versions.

Set openstackdocs_pdf_link to link to PDF file. Note that
the link to the published document only works on docs.openstack.org
where the PDF file is placed in the top-level html directory. The
site-preview places the PDF in a pdf directory.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: I661ea2f75fdd0cac7ab57bea378a58e31e204cfe

before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also

commit_message:
Remove Babel requirement

Babel is no longer a requirement for OpenStack projects.
Let's remove it and save some disk space.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-April/014227.html

Change-Id: Ib4944fb44fea53c8dd1908b7f264d45a84884639

subject: Aggregate data for podman-managed containers
messages: [{'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2020-06-05 11:02:06.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2020-06-05 11:07:10.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned\n\nwrong changeid'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-06-05 11:02:06.000000000', 'message': "Aggregate data for podman-managed containers

Merge batched containers configs, run-time and internal state tracking
data to allow users to debug or visualize containers management
process. By the end of deployment it is stored into a cached fact
(containers_manage_data) so that it can be used externally until
expired.

Also complete the list of possible and unexpected transitions of
containers tracked with the internal state machine:
* track containers to be checked for exit codes as an intermediate
  transition that must be expanded into the one of the other expeted
  end states.
* track changed containers that are expected to remain running after
  that (ones with the restart policy defined),
* track unexpected and unrecognized types of containers in the batch.

Note: this technically may be as well achieved with get_stats.
Howewer, there may be issues when such stats are not or cannot be
displayed for reasons.

This feature is controled by tripleo_container_manage_stats and
is turned off by default. It may be enabled for a particular
CI jobs or manual debugging sessions. If it shows no performance
issues in future we can turn it on by default.

Ansible tracks the following data (by merging it on the per hosts
basis):

* input containers configs passed in with json files,
* collected from podman '.State' and '.Config' infos for the
  changed or failed containers and ones that required rc checks,
* the state transitions identified by internal logic that analyzes
  runtime states such as failed or changed.

The latter is tracked in StateIdentifiedAs, that accepts a list of
the state transitions, such as:
* ('changed', 'failed', 'running') - changed is not the end state here;
* 'toCheck' - that must expand into either of:
  ('broken', 'didNotExit', 'OK') - all these are the end states;
* 'unexpected' and null.

Those state transitions are getting assigned to the intnernally tracked
containers managed in batches as the following:
* those that idientified as failed or changed and running, considered
  reached its end state and will get the corresponding state markers;
* those that changed but need further checking, will be added an
  intermediate toCheck state transition;
* those that identified as required rc check will be expanded into
  either broken, did not exit or finished OK end states;
* those identified as belonging to the batch but found in an unexpected
  state, will have the unexpected mark;
* other ones will end up having the null state. That may be containers
  managed externally, like by pacemaker. Or having non-matching config
  IDs. Or whatever reason that made them not identified by the state
  machine checker. That state also means that there was no state
  transitions for such containers at all.

Example in-directly unexpected state transitions that might point to
issues or bugs:
* toCheck is in the end of the transition,
* running or failed is followed by any other state transition.

That data may be useful for users wishing to debug issues or to build a
visual representation for the managed containers, like dependency and
state Change.

Change-Id: I2f6ce0e9ae70c7d20f6c3c54b8985f6f68b667b4
graphs-Id: I453d6d5024fd9385ad7fe3d95e7f20b92097bb7f
Partial-bug: #1879455
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Aggregate data for podman-managed containers

Merge batched containers configs, run-time and internal state tracking
data to allow users to debug or visualize containers management
process. By the end of deployment it is stored into a cached fact
(containers_manage_data) so that it can be used externally until
expired.

Also complete the list of possible and unexpected transitions of
containers tracked with the internal state machine:
* track containers to be checked for exit codes as an intermediate
  transition that must be expanded into the one of the other expeted
  end states.
* track changed containers that are expected to remain running after
  that (ones with the restart policy defined),
* track unexpected and unrecognized types of containers in the batch.

Note: this technically may be as well achieved with get_stats.
Howewer, there may be issues when such stats are not or cannot be
displayed for reasons.

This feature is controled by tripleo_container_manage_stats and
is turned off by default. It may be enabled for a particular
CI jobs or manual debugging sessions. If it shows no performance
issues in future we can turn it on by default.

Ansible tracks the following data (by merging it on the per hosts
basis):

* input containers configs passed in with json files,
* collected from podman '.State' and '.Config' infos for the
  changed or failed containers and ones that required rc checks,
* the state transitions identified by internal logic that analyzes
  runtime states such as failed or changed.

The latter is tracked in StateIdentifiedAs, that accepts a list of
the state transitions, such as:
* ('changed', 'failed', 'running') - changed is not the end state here;
* 'toCheck' - that must expand into either of:
  ('broken', 'didNotExit', 'OK') - all these are the end states;
* 'unexpected' and null.

Those state transitions are getting assigned to the intnernally tracked
containers managed in batches as the following:
* those that idientified as failed or changed and running, considered
  reached its end state and will get the corresponding state markers;
* those that changed but need further checking, will be added an
  intermediate toCheck state transition;
* those that identified as required rc check will be expanded into
  either broken, did not exit or finished OK end states;
* those identified as belonging to the batch but found in an unexpected
  state, will have the unexpected mark;
* other ones will end up having the null state. That may be containers
  managed externally, like by pacemaker. Or having non-matching config
  IDs. Or whatever reason that made them not identified by the state
  machine checker. That state also means that there was no state
  transitions for such containers at all.

Example in-directly unexpected state transitions that might point to
issues or bugs:
* toCheck is in the end of the transition,
* running or failed is followed by any other state transition.

That data may be useful for users wishing to debug issues or to build a
visual representation for the managed containers, like dependency and
state Change.

Change-Id: I2f6ce0e9ae70c7d20f6c3c54b8985f6f68b667b4
graphs-Id: I453d6d5024fd9385ad7fe3d95e7f20b92097bb7f
Partial-bug: #1879455
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Switch to using virtual envs by default

They're already used in the CI, and chances are high that non-venv installation
is broken on at least some supported systems.

Change-Id: Ie3c93a0a1537658eaccf69da3f64d0fc43f292d1

commit_message:
barbican: Use python3 plugin in uwsgi config

backport: ussuri, train

Without this the container returns an empty response.

Change-Id: Ic36845f3fc625c080c92904b58ace070dd24fbb2
Closes-Bug: #1881784

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-06-03 17:28:06.000000000', 'message': "Fix fast track when exiting cleaning

When exiting cleaning, previously the agent token was purged
from ironic's database and agents continuing to run would not
be able to heartbeat to the conductor. With agent token, this
would orphan the agent such that it thought it had an agent
token, yet the conductor did not.

Change-Id: Id6f8609bcda369649d0f677aceed26ed5e72a313
"}, {'created': '2020-06-03 17:28:16.000000000', 'message': "Fix fast track when exiting cleaning

When exiting cleaning, previously the agent token was purged
from ironic's database and agents continuing to run would not
be able to heartbeat to the conductor. With agent token, this
would orphan the agent such that it thought it had an agent
token, yet the conductor did not.

Change-Id: Id6f8609bcda369649d0f677aceed26ed5e72a313
"}]
commit_message:
Fix fast track when exiting cleaning

When exiting cleaning, previously the agent token was purged
from ironic's database and agents continuing to run would not
be able to heartbeat to the conductor. With agent token, this
would orphan the agent such that it thought it had an agent
token, yet the conductor did not.

Change-Id: Id6f8609bcda369649d0f677aceed26ed5e72a313

commit_message:
Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 and reno 3.1.0 versions. Using
these versions will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents

before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

commit_message:
Switch to tripleo stdout callback

In order to improve the UX and prevent confusion during the async status
output, we need to write a custom callback to change the text.

See See also https://github.com/ansible/ansible/issues/63926

Change-Id: Ie3021ddfe1b4ca304cfd34a46fd4e4c7e9c62e9f

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-06-03 13:44:29.000000000', 'message': "Improve facter cache reliability

We don't need to be caching EC2 metadata in our facter runs because we
don't use this. By leaving this on, it can cause problems when run on
VMs in a cloud that might support EC2.  By having this enabled, we can
see deployments failing to configure nodes because it timesout:

2020-05-13 22:38:30.574339 ERROR puppetlabs.facter - EC2 user data
request failed: Timeout was reached

Additionally if facter fails to generate the cache, the subsequent
puppet runs will fail. This change also added retries to the facter
cache call to ensure that we should be able to generate the cache if an
external fact call fails for some reason.

NOTE: The master patch for this is against tripleo-ansible

Closes-Bug: #1861917
Change-Id: Iaaed0dcf747ca4a08f8e200b43d0f2259ad0ed39
(cherry-picked from c3b57d6a6c26acf35168fea7303fc485e1dcd13f)

commit_message:
Improve facter cache reliability

We don't need to be caching EC2 metadata in our facter runs because we
don't use this. By leaving this on, it can cause problems when run on
VMs in a cloud that might support EC2.  By having this enabled, we can
see deployments failing to configure nodes because it timesout:

2020-05-13 22:38:30.574339 ERROR puppetlabs.facter - EC2 user data
request failed: Timeout was reached

Additionally if facter fails to generate the cache, the subsequent
puppet runs will fail. This change also added retries to the facter
cache call to ensure that we should be able to generate the cache if an
external fact call fails for some reason.

NOTE: The master patch for this is against tripleo-ansible

Closes-Bug: #1861917
Change-Id: Iaaed0dcf747ca4a08f8e200b43d0f2259ad0ed39
(cherry-picked from c3b57d6a6c26acf35168fea7303fc485e1dcd13f)

commit_message:
Switch to newer openstackdocstheme version

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 version. Using
this version will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: Ic02db11cddc1cb3fa1c8e25899946830ba70f239

subject: Prevent duplicate initial_master_nodes
messages: [{'account_id': 31004, 'date': '2020-05-28 13:08:38.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 28619, 'date': '2020-06-05 10:07:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 25023, 'date': '2020-06-05 10:24:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-05-28 13:08:38.000000000', 'message': 'Prevent duplicate initial_master_nodes

Elasticsearch fails to start on first run when duplicate entries in the
cluster.initial_master_nodes variable are present, as they are all required
during the initial bootstrapping. It is currently possible for duplicates
to be present in this when nodes are forced to be master-eligible using
elasticsearch_node_master: true
due to the master node setting algorithm within data-node-variables. This
commit ensures that all values within the Ansible master_nodes variable
are unique, whilst keeping the total count of master nodes the same,
preventing Elasticsearch from crashing during initial cluster discovery.

Change-Id: I3763b22ea47c9b5b0f534793ccc6a887f96dc649
'}]
commit_message:
Prevent duplicate initial_master_nodes

Elasticsearch fails to start on first run when duplicate entries in the
cluster.initial_master_nodes variable are present, as they are all required
during the initial bootstrapping. It is currently possible for duplicates
to be present in this when nodes are forced to be master-eligible using
elasticsearch_node_master: true
due to the master node setting algorithm within data-node-variables. This
commit ensures that all values within the Ansible master_nodes variable
are unique, whilst keeping the total count of master nodes the same,
preventing Elasticsearch from crashing during initial cluster discovery.

Change-Id: I3763b22ea47c9b5b0f534793ccc6a887f96dc649

The node.name Logstash config variable is currently hard coded
to inventory_hostname in the elastic_logstash role. This commit
exposes the option to modify this, which allows Logstash to be
identified under a more readable name in e.g. Kibana. The default
behaviour is unchanged.

Change-Id: Ic3b21d54c9759117550cc85bade3dc7900d0f502
'}]
commit_message:
Allow Logstash node.name override

The node.name Logstash config variable is currently hard coded
to inventory_hostname in the elastic_logstash role. This commit
exposes the option to modify this, which allows Logstash to be
identified under a more readable name in e.g. Kibana. The default
behaviour is unchanged.

Change-Id: Ic3b21d54c9759117550cc85bade3dc7900d0f502

[{'created': '2020-06-04 19:12:27.000000000', 'message': "Exclude http store if --all-stores specified for import/copy operation

If operator has configured read-only 'http' store in multiple stores and while
importing or copying existing image in multiple stores if user has specified
--all-stores true then depending on `allow-failure`; if it is True then image
is imported/copied to other stores than http or if it is false then image can
not be imported/copied to other stores as well. Aslo, new image property
`os_glance_failed_imports` shows `http` as failed store.

Excluded `http` store from the list of stores for import/copying workflow
if user specifies --all-stores as True.

Change-Id: I2ad41022aa709491881e78129708da0ccc25f4f6
Closes-Bug: #1881958
(cherry picked from commit f7b163119052b96e3d1577c61982ef3b18ecdc97)
"}]
commit_message:
Exclude http store if --all-stores specified for import/copy operation

If operator has configured read-only 'http' store in multiple stores and while
importing or copying existing image in multiple stores if user has specified
--all-stores true then depending on `allow-failure`; if it is True then image
is imported/copied to other stores than http or if it is false then image can
not be imported/copied to other stores as well. Aslo, new image property
`os_glance_failed_imports` shows `http` as failed store.

Excluded `http` store from the list of stores for import/copying workflow
if user specifies --all-stores as True.

Change-Id: I2ad41022aa709491881e78129708da0ccc25f4f6
Closes-Bug: #1881958
(cherry picked from commit f7b163119052b96e3d1577c61982ef3b18ecdc97)

[{'created': '2019-03-11 15:31:36.000000000', 'message': "Clarify the advice on tags when creating a resource

A recent discussion [0] on the email list showed that there was
confusion regarding assigning tags when creating a new resource. Since
we didn't mention this particular case, it was interpreted that the
resource had to be created first, and then the tags assigned to it,
taking two API calls. This change clarifies that by explicitly adding
the case for creating a new resource.

While editing this file, I noticed that several of the API examples had
mixed usage of single quotes and double quotes. I changed that so that
these lines have consistent usage.

[0] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-February/003116.html

Change-Id: If9321693155e38cb3d1369d49d0b35ee2bbd642b
"}]
commit_message:
Clarify the advice on tags when creating a resource

A recent discussion [0] on the email list showed that there was
confusion regarding assigning tags when creating a new resource. Since
we didn't mention this particular case, it was interpreted that the
resource had to be created first, and then the tags assigned to it,
taking two API calls. This change clarifies that by explicitly adding
the case for creating a new resource.

While editing this file, I noticed that several of the API examples had
mixed usage of single quotes and double quotes. I changed that so that
these lines have consistent usage.

[0] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-February/003116.html

Change-Id: If9321693155e38cb3d1369d49d0b35ee2bbd642b

commit_message:
Drop hard requirement on debootstrap and EPEL

EPEL is only needed for debootstrap, debootstrap is only needed when
building Debian/Ubuntu images. Install it on demand and update the docs.

Change-Id: I6b90c91f20b5acd198cabbb89f21a72caaf90c63

commit_message:
Use unittest.mock instead of third party mock

we currently don't support py2 and py3 has removed mock to
unittest module.

Change-Id: I16810bd8dcdb41abf6613f8703b64ea8af4bd0b8

commit_message:
Install uWSGI from PyPI to repair CentOS 8 support

CentOS 8 does not have uWSGI, not even in EPEL:
https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1757157

Since it's installable from PyPI, let's do it instead.
Also update SELinux to enable uWSGI+nginx to operate.

Change-Id: I44d0582e221e24404f427b261bf6d366f5c32775

commit_message:
Switch to RDO Ussuri release on CentOS

This change switches from the Delorean yum repositories to the RDO
Ussuri release repository.

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-05-12 21:27:29.000000000', 'message': 'Implement Basic HTTP authentication middleware

When the config option ``auth_strategy`` is set to ``basic`` then
non-public API calls require a valid HTTP Basic authentication header
to be set. The config option ``auth_basic_user_file`` defaults to
``/etc/ironic/htpasswd`` and points to a file which supports the
Apache htpasswd syntax[1]. This file is read for every request, so no
service restart is required when changes are made.

The only password digest supported is bcrypt, and the ``bcrypt``
python library is used for password checks since it supports ``$2y$``
prefixed bcrypt passwords as generated by the Apache htpasswd utility.

To try basic authentication, the following can be done:

* Set ``/etc/ironic/ironic.conf`` ``DEFAULT`` ``auth_strategy`` to ``basic``
* Populate the htpasswd file with entries, for example:
  ``htpasswd -nbB myName myPassword >> /etc/ironic/htpasswd``
* Make basic authenticated HTTP requests, for example:
  ``curl --user myName:myPassword http://localhost:6385/v1/drivers``

[1] https://httpd.apache.org/docs/current/misc/password_encryptions.html

Change-Id: I7b89155d8bbd2f48e186c12adea9d6932cd0bfe2
Story: 2007656
Task: 39740

commit_message:
Enable Basic HTTP authentication middleware

When the config option ``auth_strategy`` is set to ``http_basic`` then
non-public API calls require a valid HTTP Basic authentication header
to be set. The config option ``http_basic_auth_user_file`` defaults to
``/etc/ironic/htpasswd`` and points to a file which supports the
Apache htpasswd syntax[1]. This file is read for every request, so no
service restart is required when changes are made.

The only password digest supported is bcrypt, and the ``bcrypt``
python library is used for password checks since it supports ``$2y$``
prefixed bcrypt passwords as generated by the Apache htpasswd utility.

To try HTTP basic authentication, the following can be done:

* Set ``/etc/ironic/ironic.conf`` ``DEFAULT`` ``auth_strategy`` to ``http_basic``
* Populate the htpasswd file with entries, for example:
  ``htpasswd -nbB myName myPassword >> /etc/ironic/htpasswd``
* Make basic authenticated HTTP requests, for example:
  ``curl --user myName:myPassword http://localhost:6385/v1/drivers``

[1] https://httpd.apache.org/docs/current/misc/password_encryptions.html

Change-Id: I7b89155d8bbd2f48e186c12adea9d6932cd0bfe2
Story: 2007656
Task: 39825
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/729070
