subject: Switch to newer openstackdocstheme version
messages:
[{'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2020-06-03 18:59:47.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 9562, 'date': '2020-06-04 08:07:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

Thanks Andreas fro the updates.

Best Regards,
Ildikó'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2020-06-04 17:03:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-06-03 18:59:47.000000000', 'message': "Switch to newer openstackdocstheme version

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 version. Using
this version will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Disable openstackdocs_auto_version to not auto-version the documents.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: I5ff3f372c12db0efeb26737b31006e88ddc238a0
"}]
commit_message:
Switch to newer openstackdocstheme version

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 version. Using
this version will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Disable openstackdocs_auto_version to not auto-version the documents.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: I5ff3f372c12db0efeb26737b31006e88ddc238a0

commit_message:
Switch to newer openstackdocstheme version

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 version. Using
this version will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Disable openstackdocs_auto_version to not auto-version the documents.

'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can

not needed anymore, remove them.

commit_message:
Use api_interface as migration_interface default value

normally, api_interface is treated as internal and security network plane,
use it as default migration_interface is more meaningful.

Change-Id: Ib9f4bcc19147a49dc09bd905dcd06be165a91b5e
(cherry picked from commit 4955a9c020855f74ab1a5e30d941c46f717485bc)

the following services:
* Keystone - 35357

* Swift Proxy and Ironic PXE that rely on xinetd - 49001

Closes-Bug: #1820576

Change-Id: I71308a65bea5f59d755b766165dabf5d3e646ee1

(cherry picked from commit ffd31df7d3b6eb415bae76291b4adaaab4da8dd0)
'}]
commit_message:
Add reserved ports for some services

Exclude ports from the ephemeral pool ranges that can be shared by
the following services:
* Keystone - 35357
* Qpidd/matahari - 49000
* Clustercheck  - 49000-49001 (xinetd)
* Swift Proxy and Ironic PXE that rely on xinetd - 49001

Closes-Bug: #1820576

Change-Id: I71308a65bea5f59d755b766165dabf5d3e646ee1
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit ffd31df7d3b6eb415bae76291b4adaaab4da8dd0)

commit_message:
Add release note for cinder-ceph required relation ceph-access

Due to the change [1] cinder-ceph now has a required relation to
nova-compute.  This release note change notifies the world that bundles
might need updates and to verify models prior to charm upgrade.

[1] Iedbf4aafc2348cbf6f14257417e86aa9aeb48a81

Change-Id: I475da6d391a2e9e028f367b4f614b9555a746f2b
Closes-Bug: #1881246

commit_message:
Revert "Improve ansible logging within tripleoclient"

The specs was not ready and wrongly approved.

This reverts commit e9665ed8bb5c2a495680451f9d5d7a1bfd45d1ca.

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-05-21 12:38:49.000000000', 'message': "Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 and reno 3.1.0 versions. Using
these versions will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Set openstackdocs_pdf_link to link to PDF file. Note that
the link to the published document only works on docs.openstack.org
where the PDF file is placed in the top-level html directory. The
site-preview places the PDF in a pdf directory.

Disable openstackdocs_auto_name to use 'project' variable as name.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: Ibf877ecf4ee043017d0ca219595cee859b7092dc
"}]
commit_message:
Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 and reno 3.1.0 versions. Using
these versions will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Set openstackdocs_pdf_link to link to PDF file. Note that
the link to the published document only works on docs.openstack.org
where the PDF file is placed in the top-level html directory. The
site-preview places the PDF in a pdf directory.

Disable openstackdocs_auto_name to use 'project' variable as name.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: Ibf877ecf4ee043017d0ca219595cee859b7092dc

commit_message:
CI: use wheels from infra mirror

If they are available then we do not need to build them. Especially
AArch64 jobs will speedup (once wheels are built).

(copied from Kolla playbooks)

Change-Id: I03983947a4d509600d110506bec706961a23e41a

Bump MariaDB version to 10.4

Patch aims to use next stable release of MariaDB

Remove no_log from functional tests, the only credentials used here
are for the purposes of the test and debug output is valuable.

[{'created': '2020-05-19 05:49:41.000000000', 'message': "Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.0 and reno 3.1.0 versions. Using
these versions will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

Set openstackdocs_pdf_link to link to PDF file. Note that
the link to the published document only works on docs.openstack.org
where the PDF file is placed in the top-level html directory. The
site-preview places the PDF in a pdf directory.

Set openstackdocs_auto_name to use 'project' as name.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/728938

commit_message:
Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 and reno 3.1.0 versions. Using
these versions will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

Set openstackdocs_pdf_link to link to PDF file. Note that
the link to the published document only works on docs.openstack.org
where the PDF file is placed in the top-level html directory. The
site-preview places the PDF in a pdf directory.

Set openstackdocs_auto_name to use 'project' as name.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: I8e6c4b1d09e5f56b505c6006ea048baf896444c3

commit_message:
Add PDF documentation build

This commit adds PDF documentation build target 'pdf-docs' that will
build PDF versions of our docs.

This is one of the Train community goals:

 https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/train/pdf-doc-generation.html

Change-Id: Iae6bc9ae92fe61385c424923eaad35dc449880e9
Story: #2006070
Task: #35464

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-06-02 14:09:15.000000000', 'message': "Avoid unconditional fact gathering

One way to improve the performance of Ansible is through fact caching.
Rather than gather facts in every play, we can configure Ansible to
cache them in a persistent store. An example Ansible configuration for
doing this is as follows:

[defaults]
gathering = smart
fact_caching = jsonfile
fact_caching_connection = ./facts
fact_caching_timeout = 86400

This does not affect Kolla Ansible however, since we use the setup
module which unconditionally gathers facts regardless of the state of
the cache. This gets worse with large inventories limited to a small
batch of hosts via --limit or serial, since the limited hosts must
gather facts for all others.

One way to detect whether facts exist for a host is via the
'module_setup' variable, which exists only when facts exist. This change
uses the 'module_setup' fact to determine whether facts need to be
gathered for hosts outside of the batch. For hosts in the batch, we
switch from using the setup module to gather_facts on the play, which
can use the 'smart' gathering logic.

Change-Id: I04841fb62b2e1d9e97ce4b75ce3a7349b9c74036
Partially-Implements: blueprint performance-improvements
(cherry picked from commit e0ba55a85d617c12f51be41c10778696ffc5004c)
"}]
commit_message:
Avoid unconditional fact gathering

One way to improve the performance of Ansible is through fact caching.
Rather than gather facts in every play, we can configure Ansible to
cache them in a persistent store. An example Ansible configuration for
doing this is as follows:

[defaults]
gathering = smart
fact_caching = jsonfile
fact_caching_connection = ./facts
fact_caching_timeout = 86400

This does not affect Kolla Ansible however, since we use the setup
module which unconditionally gathers facts regardless of the state of
the cache. This gets worse with large inventories limited to a small
batch of hosts via --limit or serial, since the limited hosts must
gather facts for all others.

One way to detect whether facts exist for a host is via the
'module_setup' variable, which exists only when facts exist. This change
uses the 'module_setup' fact to determine whether facts need to be
gathered for hosts outside of the batch. For hosts in the batch, we
switch from using the setup module to gather_facts on the play, which
can use the 'smart' gathering logic.

Change-Id: I04841fb62b2e1d9e97ce4b75ce3a7349b9c74036
Partially-Implements: blueprint performance-improvements
(cherry picked from commit e0ba55a85d617c12f51be41c10778696ffc5004c)

commit_message:
Always reset CONF when starting the wsgi app

This ensures that options loaded during any prior run of the
application are dropped before being added again during init_application.

Change-Id: I4267071cdfcb6319ed02e355a9c761fce58e5383

subject: Require neutron-lib for base test template
messages:
[{'account_id': 10273, 'date': '2020-05-26 23:03:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 8313, 'date': '2020-05-28 11:31:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

This will work only if the patch is merged to neutron-lib master, but not for active not merged patchset, or am I missing something?

That is a step forward, but will not solve the depends-on problem.'}, {'account_id': 15554, 'date': '2020-05-28 12:07:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

This is not first time this idea comes up.

Currently we have a tradeoff where no end of it is perfect, but at the price of some inconvenience it's workable.

1) We could test with master neutron-lib:

pro: It's easier (with a working Depends-On) to work on changes affecting both neutron and neutron-lib.
con: We cannot guarantee that master neutron is not broken with the last release of neutron-lib, and that is the neutron-lib version our end users use.

2) We could (and now we do) test with the last release of neutron-lib:

pro: We can guarantee that neutron works with the last release of neutron-lib.
con: It adds inconvenience to work with two-repo changes.

How we usually handle this inconvenience:

If you're not in a rush you wait until your neutron-lib patch is merged and released. Feel free to propose a neutron-lib release in openstack/releases to speed this up (please give a heads-up on irc if you do this).

If you want to move faster, we usually accept temporarily duplicated code. For example you propose module 'foo' in neutron-lib, but it's not merged or not released yet. Feel free to add an exact copy of it to your neutron change under the name '_foo' with an extra TODO comment to remove it when the same gets available in neutron-lib.

When the neutron-lib part gets released please follow up with a neutron patch that removes _foo and replaces 'import _foo' with 'import foo'.

We could also move to enable some tests both with master neutron-lib and the last release of neutron-lib. Still only one of them could vote. Simply doubling all our tests would put enourmous extra load on the gate. One idea I personally liked in the past (but nobody followed through with its implementation) that an experimental (triggered with a review comment) non-voting job could run tests with master neutron-lib in addition to what we have today.

Or tell us please if you propose this for a different reason, or you see better alternatives..."}]

commit_message:
Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 and reno 3.1.0 versions. Using
these versions will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Disable openstackdocs_auto_name to use 'project' variable as name.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

Remove docs requirements from lower-constraints and test-requirements, they
are not needed during install or test but only for docs building.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: I67fd82bf3755ee6942f8c97a05cd939225ddf5ad

[{'created': '2020-05-27 23:59:57.000000000', 'message': 'Use systemd units to enable tcp/tls in libvirt

Since v5.7.0, libvirt requires that proper socket unit is used to
listen on tcp/tls, and the usage of --listen option is forbidden
by default[1].
This patch makes puppet-nova depend on socket units instead of listen
option, to avoid failure when systemd tries to start libvrit service.

[1] https://github.com/libvirt/libvirt/commit/3a6a725b8f575890ee6c151ad1f46ea0ceea1f3b

Change-Id: I902169f54ff723c8f35ce12a7909950f61b4b7c6
Closes-Bug: #1880619
(cherry picked from commit 87f2437bdce84f46c8180d30acaec32d472669ba)
'}]
commit_message:
Use systemd units to enable tcp/tls in libvirt

Since v5.7.0, libvirt requires that proper socket unit is used to
listen on tcp/tls, and the usage of --listen option is forbidden
by default[1].
This patch makes puppet-nova depend on socket units instead of listen
option, to avoid failure when systemd tries to start libvrit service.

[1] https://github.com/libvirt/libvirt/commit/3a6a725b8f575890ee6c151ad1f46ea0ceea1f3b

Change-Id: I902169f54ff723c8f35ce12a7909950f61b4b7c6
Closes-Bug: #1880619
(cherry picked from commit 87f2437bdce84f46c8180d30acaec32d472669ba)

commit_message:
Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 and reno 3.1.0 versions. Using
these versions will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Set openstackdocs_auto_name to use 'project' as name.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: If718e3d21c682dd3a3d297cfa9cebb333d59aef3

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-06-02 18:18:23.000000000', 'message': "Stop to use the __future__ module.

The __future__ module [1] was used in this context to ensure compatibility
between python 2 and python 3.

We previously dropped the support of python 2.7 [2] and now we only support
python 3 so we don't need to continue to use this module and the imports
listed below.

Imports commonly used and their related PEPs:
- `division` is related to PEP 238 [3]
- `print_function` is related to PEP 3105 [4]
- `unicode_literals` is related to PEP 3112 [5]
- `with_statement` is related to PEP 343 [6]
- `absolute_import` is related to PEP 328 [7]

[1] https://docs.python.org/3/library/__future__.html
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html
[3] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0238
[4] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3105
[5] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3112
[6] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0343
[7] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0328

Change-Id: Ic03754dcaaa4f1c0018294aa52bb05d956aa5d10

commit_message:
Stop to use the __future__ module.

The __future__ module [1] was used in this context to ensure compatibility
between python 2 and python 3.

We previously dropped the support of python 2.7 [2] and now we only support
python 3 so we don't need to continue to use this module and the imports
listed below.

Imports commonly used and their related PEPs:
- `division` is related to PEP 238 [3]
- `print_function` is related to PEP 3105 [4]
- `unicode_literals` is related to PEP 3112 [5]
- `with_statement` is related to PEP 343 [6]
- `absolute_import` is related to PEP 328 [7]

[1] https://docs.python.org/3/library/__future__.html
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html
[3] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0238
[4] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3105
[5] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3112
[6] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0343
[7] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0328

Change-Id: Ic03754dcaaa4f1c0018294aa52bb05d956aa5d10

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-05-31 15:51:58.000000000', 'message': "Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 and reno 3.1.0 versions. Using
these versions will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Disable openstackdocs_auto_name to use 'project' variable as name.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: I54eee940d3c787fddc1278619981d7a90310fbd0
"}]
commit_message:
Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 and reno 3.1.0 versions. Using
these versions will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Disable openstackdocs_auto_name to use 'project' variable as name.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: I54eee940d3c787fddc1278619981d7a90310fbd0

Hi Rico, are you copying the code from Magnum repo? Is there any other change? I just want to understand if Magnum can use this image out-of-box. Thanks for the work.'}, {'account_id': 12404, 'date': '2020-03-23 07:48:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 17:

> Hi Rico, are you copying the code from Magnum repo? Is there any
 > other change? I just want to understand if Magnum can use this
 > image out-of-box. Thanks for the work.

Yes, it's copied from Magnum as I mentioned in [1]. I remove some K8s specific stuff, which I believe you can add it back when you inherit from this one. So the basic requirement for Magnum should be satisfied by default. We can work together in more detail to make sure it's reusable for Magnum

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-March/013310.html"}, {'account_id': 6484, 'date': '2020-03-30 03:29:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 17:

(2 comments)

@Rico, thanks for working on this. One thing I'm wondering is how can we manage the code when it's being managed by Heat team. I mean, now Magnum team can change the code based on the Magnum requirements. Will it be more restricted when it's under the Heat tent?"}, {'account_id': 12404, 'date': '2020-03-30 03:40:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 17:

> (2 comments)
 > 
 > @Rico, thanks for working on this. One thing I'm wondering is how
 > can we manage the code when it's being managed by Heat team. I
 > mean, now Magnum team can change the code based on the Magnum
 > requirements. Will it be more restricted when it's under the Heat
 > tent?

I think it will make sense in the following scenario
1. Heat build and publish basic agents image
2. Magnum builds heat-agent with specific requirements base on image from step one.

So I imaging from Magnum side, it's only few script removed and add From openstackheat/heat-agents:latest instead. The heat container agent magnum built will keep releasing, but the Dockerfile will change. It that sounds an ideal plan for Magnum?"}, {'account_id': 12404, 'date': '2020-05-18 05:39:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 17:

bump'}, {'account_id': 6484, 'date': '2020-05-23 21:09:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 17:

@Spyros, @Bharat, could I get you guys comments on putting the heat-container-agent task in Heat and remove it from Magnum?'}, {'account_id': 20498, 'date': '2020-05-26 08:41:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 17:

We can have it here too. If we are the only users, I don't see a reason why would we want to lose the ACLs and maintenance of the image."}, {'account_id': 20498, 'date': '2020-05-26 08:45:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 17:

(5 comments)'}, {'account_id': 6484, 'date': '2020-05-27 02:28:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 17:

@Spyros, thanks for your comments.'}]

commit_message:
CI for heat container agent build and publish

Allow build heat container agent, and add build task as
check and gate job, and push task as post job.

Change-Id: Ib914af0c91209ffbd451d570bf986ead0835958f

commit_message:
Fix pre-commit-hook

Currently pre-commit-hook is failing due to yaml validations using
unversioned python and using non-existent json validations.

Change-Id: I67dc11efe667e2cc67ea1a731edc5c4a03ebd1e7
Closes-Bug: #1778146

running the neutron ovs agent.

(cherry picked from commit a483d0b53c8b05607082943870c5a3d852f9a622)
'}]
commit_message:
Start/enable OVS on neutron ovs agent nodes

Start and enable the openvswitch service during host prep for hosts
running the neutron ovs agent.

Note: this is pre-stein only as stein uses systemd dependencies to make
sure openvswitch is running when needed.

Change-Id: I5cea8cf283df45c965017e444a8363278666896c
Closes-Bug: #1804264
(cherry picked from commit a483d0b53c8b05607082943870c5a3d852f9a622)

commit_message:
Redesign OpenstackModule class

don't inherit OpenstackModule class from AnsibleModule class to
prevent occasional overriding Ansible methods or vars and failing
module.

Change-Id: Ic34fff0c938eb87cc0d2c5e98fbafed64bf349f6

[{'created': '2020-05-21 14:12:42.000000000', 'message': "Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 and reno 3.1.0 versions. Using
these versions will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Set openstackdocs_pdf_link to link to PDF file. Note that
the link to the published document only works on docs.openstack.org
where the PDF file is placed in the top-level html directory. The
site-preview places the PDF in a pdf directory.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can

not needed anymore, remove them.

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: Ib2fc9304a6db9f01eb6d0eb82363906fd322612f
"}]
commit_message:
Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 and reno 3.1.0 versions. Using
these versions will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Set openstackdocs_pdf_link to link to PDF file. Note that
the link to the published document only works on docs.openstack.org
where the PDF file is placed in the top-level html directory. The
site-preview places the PDF in a pdf directory.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: Ib2fc9304a6db9f01eb6d0eb82363906fd322612f

commit_message:
Refactor workflow notifications

* Moved all notification management for workflows into the method
  Workflow.set_state(). It's now in one place. Workflow events are
  now also identified in one method similar to how it works for
  tasks based on state transitions.
* Other style changes.

Change-Id: I40941ecca3eb4b46a06a2f7dc2fd5d909d5d087a

commit_message:
Refactor task notifications

* All calls to a notifier within the Task class have now been
  moved into the method set_state() so that the relation between
  a state change and a notification is now straightforward and the
  notification calls don't have to be spread out across different
  modules.

Change-Id: I9c0647235e1439049d3e7db13f19bef542f10508

commit_message:
Add volume.manage to metrics.

This allows to monitor cinder managed ceph volumes
to be monitored.
The second addition here allows the same for snapshots.

Change-Id: I7f045fa618e78351e05ad69bc9580e98487f0c29

passwords are stored in separate file and are retrieved during each attach/detach

Change-Id: Ib7778ba9d38a68d8b56ca632c5f1c353d55830b0
'}]
commit_message:
Remove VxFlex OS credentials from connection_properties

VxFlex OS password is not stored in block_device_mapping table. Instead of this
passwords are stored in separate file and are retrieved during each attach/detach
operation.

Closes-Bug: #1823200
Change-Id: Ib7778ba9d38a68d8b56ca632c5f1c353d55830b0

commit_message:
Switch to newer openstackdocstheme version

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 version. Using
this version will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: I87335b8494a7b1b3eddd3b6b46b5b5d04227bb6d

[{'created': '2020-06-04 08:59:51.000000000', 'message': 'Switch to Monasca API for logs

The Monasca Log API has been removed and in this change we switch
to using the unified API. If dedicated log APIs are required then
this can be supported through configuration. Out of the box the
Monasca API is used for both logs and metrics which is envisaged to
work for most use cases.

In order to use the unified API for logs, we need to disable the
legacy Kafka client. We also rename the Monasca API config file
to remove a warning about using the old style name.

(cherry picked from commit b39a0f805ae1d90b4406fb54d0672789e3c01348)

commit_message:
Switch to Monasca API for logs

The Monasca Log API has been removed and in this change we switch
to using the unified API. If dedicated log APIs are required then
this can be supported through configuration. Out of the box the
Monasca API is used for both logs and metrics which is envisaged to
work for most use cases.

In order to use the unified API for logs, we need to disable the
legacy Kafka client. We also rename the Monasca API config file
to remove a warning about using the old style name.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/728638
Change-Id: I9b6bf5b6690f4b4b3445e7d15a40e45dd42d2e84
(cherry picked from commit b39a0f805ae1d90b4406fb54d0672789e3c01348)

commit_message:
Ping external resource in the neutron tests

In patch [1] new test, which tests connectivity from the VM to
the outside world wos introduced.
This test if skipped by default, unless "global_ip_address" will
be set.
So this patch sets global_ip_address to be "zuul_site_mirror_fqdn"
value.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/727764/

Change-Id: Ie86f8ded8d07012d752800d2c2c471f4ebed583c

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-06-03 16:06:42.000000000', 'message': 'Fix docker-devicemapper playbook

Backport: train

Commit efb8b8bd27d08469c94f103b7314e9905cf6aa0e introduced in Train uses
docker_storage_driver in a Kayobe top-level playbook, but this variable
was only defined in defaults of the docker-devicemapper role. Unless
docker_storage_driver is explicitly set by the operator, the
docker-devicemapper playbook would fail due to the variable being
undefined.

Change-Id: I5e8219d1807b1a4e3ec65f5478eb3f1c7c02b241
Story: 2007719
Task: 39857
'}]
commit_message:
Fix docker-devicemapper playbook

Backport: train

Commit efb8b8bd27d08469c94f103b7314e9905cf6aa0e introduced in Train uses
docker_storage_driver in a Kayobe top-level playbook, but this variable
was only defined in defaults of the docker-devicemapper role. Unless
docker_storage_driver is explicitly set by the operator, the
docker-devicemapper playbook would fail due to the variable being
undefined.

Change-Id: I5e8219d1807b1a4e3ec65f5478eb3f1c7c02b241
Story: 2007719
Task: 39857

commit_message:
Switch to newer openstackdocstheme version

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 version. Using
this version will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Disable openstackdocs_auto_name to use 'project' variable as name.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: I611663fd224ddbd8a315732966c60ca67a5ffc40

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-30 17:50:44.000000000', 'message': 'Add log if resource_filters json does not exist

Change-Id: I576bd786d8da5b14b5e6c0eb7d17182b1b7e0b81
'}, {'created': '2020-04-30 17:51:56.000000000', 'message': 'Add log if resource_filters json does not exist

Change-Id: I576bd786d8da5b14b5e6c0eb7d17182b1b7e0b81
'}, {'created': '2020-05-03 20:45:36.000000000', 'message': "Add log if resource_filters json does not exist

Currently if resource_filters.json isn't provided there
wont be an error message, but it will limit the actions
that regular users can take. It can be difficult for
admins to detect this, as this file does not apply
to anyone with admin permissions.

This patch adds a warning if the file for some reason
does not exist. This could happen if it was a missed
step after upgrading Cinder.

Change-Id: I576bd786d8da5b14b5e6c0eb7d17182b1b7e0b81
"}, {'created': '2020-05-15 20:59:42.000000000', 'message': "Add log if resource_filters json does not exist

Currently if resource_filters.json isn't provided there
is no error message, but it will limit the actions
that regular users can take. Because of this it can be
difficult for admins to detect this issue, as this file
does not apply to anyone with admin permissions.

commit_message:
Add log if resource_filters json does not exist

Currently if resource_filters.json isn't provided there
is no error message, but it will limit the actions
that regular users can take. Because of this it can be
difficult for admins to detect this issue, as this file
does not apply to anyone with admin permissions.

This patch adds an error message if the file for some
reason does not exist. This could happen if a step was
missed when upgrading Cinder.

Change-Id: I576bd786d8da5b14b5e6c0eb7d17182b1b7e0b81

commit_message:
Bump version of os-images role

Version 1.9.0 of stackhpc.os-images removes the dependency
on shade and replaces it with openstacksdk.  This version
is required for python3 support.

Change-Id: If0d73e13b5922ae071671d2c7983dda6a6c5ae5e
Co-Authored-By: Sebastian Luna Valero <sebastian.luna.valero@gmail.com>
Story: 2006574

(cherry picked from commit d4120473c66313e3e6081f7c9d4e5ba0e508e95c)

commit_message:
Add reserved ports for some services

Exclude ports from the ephemeral pool ranges that can be shared by
the following services:
* Keystone - 35357
* Qpidd/matahari - 49000
* Clustercheck  - 49000-49001 (xinetd)
* Swift Proxy and Ironic PXE that rely on xinetd - 49001

Closes-Bug: #1820576

Change-Id: I71308a65bea5f59d755b766165dabf5d3e646ee1
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit ffd31df7d3b6eb415bae76291b4adaaab4da8dd0)

subject: Switch to newer openstackdocstheme version
messages: [{'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2020-06-03 19:02:55.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 23924, 'date': '2020-06-04 12:54:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-06-03 19:02:55.000000000', 'message': "Switch to newer openstackdocstheme version

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 version. Using
this version will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Disable openstackdocs_auto_name to use 'project' variable as name.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: I42bbf32877a99d91aade69d93a52a4ace000122c
"}]
commit_message:
Switch to newer openstackdocstheme version

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 version. Using
this version will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Disable openstackdocs_auto_name to use 'project' variable as name.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: I42bbf32877a99d91aade69d93a52a4ace000122c

commit_message:
Drop monitoring of nova-compute process

This is pretty problematic check as after each minor upgrade
it cause cycle nova-compute restart (and all hypervisors being down)
until masakari-processmonitor upgrade and restart.

Change-Id: Iacf5086ce6443b3504d582cd8c7a82dd1d4c7fb5

commit_message:
Update files used to seed new bind units

It looks like the focal version of named is compiled with lmdb
support where as the bionic version is not. This means that on
Focal+ zone information is stored in a nzd file rather than
nzf. This change ensure that nzd files are also used to seed new
units.

Change-Id: Ib1954ec01d78518da064b0912b91643c153d543e
Closes-Bug: #1881532

commit_message:
Stop to use the __future__ module.

The __future__ module [1] was used in this context to ensure compatibility
between python 2 and python 3.

We previously dropped the support of python 2.7 [2] and now we only support
python 3 so we don't need to continue to use this module and the imports
listed below.

Imports commonly used and their related PEPs:
- `division` is related to PEP 238 [3]
- `print_function` is related to PEP 3105 [4]
- `unicode_literals` is related to PEP 3112 [5]
- `with_statement` is related to PEP 343 [6]
- `absolute_import` is related to PEP 328 [7]

[1] https://docs.python.org/3/library/__future__.html
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html
[3] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0238
[4] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3105
[5] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3112
[6] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0343
[7] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0328

Change-Id: I2471123ec7f3ea0b872f5054d6160bcd88a104b0

commit_message:
Use api_interface as migration_interface default value

normally, api_interface is treated as internal and security network plane,
use it as default migration_interface is more meaningful.

commit_message:
Use tag for dib

Stable/train and older branches have py27 support, since diskimage-builder
removed the support we can't relly on the master branch. Let's use the
tag 2.38.0 since still provides py27 support.

Conflicts:
        playbooks/roles/bifrost-prep-for-install/defaults/main.yml

Change-Id: I378510457650e1502fb4c30b13601b222b289825
(cherry picked from commit 9626f7a557c159a620d8ea2905b1995c22807cea)

commit_message:
Stop to use the __future__ module.

The __future__ module [1] was used in this context to ensure compatibility
between python 2 and python 3.

We previously dropped the support of python 2.7 [2] and now we only support
python 3 so we don't need to continue to use this module and the imports
listed below.

Imports commonly used and their related PEPs:
- `division` is related to PEP 238 [3]
- `print_function` is related to PEP 3105 [4]
- `unicode_literals` is related to PEP 3112 [5]
- `with_statement` is related to PEP 343 [6]
- `absolute_import` is related to PEP 328 [7]

[1] https://docs.python.org/3/library/__future__.html
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html
[3] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0238
[4] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3105
[5] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3112
[6] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0343
[7] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0328

Change-Id: Ie97dcb610b6c723ba08a84ad79763bbbd4af20d9

commit_message:
Stop to use the __future__ module.

The __future__ module [1] was used in this context to ensure compatibility
between python 2 and python 3.

We previously dropped the support of python 2.7 [2] and now we only support
python 3 so we don't need to continue to use this module and the imports
listed below.

Imports commonly used and their related PEPs:
- `division` is related to PEP 238 [3]
- `print_function` is related to PEP 3105 [4]
- `unicode_literals` is related to PEP 3112 [5]
- `with_statement` is related to PEP 343 [6]
- `absolute_import` is related to PEP 328 [7]

[1] https://docs.python.org/3/library/__future__.html
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html
[3] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0238
[4] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3105
[5] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3112
[6] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0343
[7] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0328

Change-Id: I907008ff4102806a6f7c88572f89f3beb500d9d7

messages: [{'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2020-06-03 16:18:51.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2020-06-03 17:43:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2020-06-04 07:23:36.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2020-06-04 07:24:17.000000000', 'content': 'Topic changed from fix-docs to reno-openstackdocstheme'}, {'account_id': 25023, 'date': '2020-06-04 08:19:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 28619, 'date': '2020-06-04 11:11:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-06-03 16:18:51.000000000', 'message': 'Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 and reno 3.1.0 versions. Using
these versions will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Set openstackdocs_pdf_link to link to PDF file. Note that
the link to the published document only works on docs.openstack.org
where the PDF file is placed in the top-level html directory. The
site-preview places the PDF in a pdf directory.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: Id2c810e9214981f381d5a9d4f1f2e40cb63a02af
'}, {'created': '2020-06-04 07:23:36.000000000', 'message': 'Use newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions

The sync from https://review.opendev.org/733244 updated to
openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 and reno 3.1.0 versions.

Set openstackdocs_pdf_link to link to PDF file. Note that
the link to the published document only works on docs.openstack.org
where the PDF file is placed in the top-level html directory. The
site-preview places the PDF in a pdf directory.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: Id2c810e9214981f381d5a9d4f1f2e40cb63a02af
'}]
commit_message:
Use newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions

The sync from https://review.opendev.org/733244 updated to
openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 and reno 3.1.0 versions.

Set openstackdocs_pdf_link to link to PDF file. Note that
the link to the published document only works on docs.openstack.org
where the PDF file is placed in the top-level html directory. The
site-preview places the PDF in a pdf directory.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: Id2c810e9214981f381d5a9d4f1f2e40cb63a02af

commit_message:
Enable syncing of docs

The docs job is failing in https://review.opendev.org/671840 and thus
nothing is synced in from openstack-ansible-tests. The failure is due to
the removal of entries from doc/requirements.txt. Add those
to test-requirements.txt instead.

commit_message:
Use tag for dib

Stable/train and older branches have py27 support, since diskimage-builder
removed the support we can't relly on the master branch. Let's use the
tag 2.38.0 since still provides py27 support.

Conflicts:
        playbooks/roles/bifrost-prep-for-install/defaults/main.yml

Change-Id: I378510457650e1502fb4c30b13601b222b289825
(cherry picked from commit 9626f7a557c159a620d8ea2905b1995c22807cea)

subject: Stop to use the __future__ module.
messages: [{'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2020-06-02 18:11:04.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 13252, 'date': '2020-06-03 08:58:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2020-06-04 09:56:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-06-02 18:11:04.000000000', 'message': "Stop to use the __future__ module.

The __future__ module [1] was used in this context to ensure compatibility
between python 2 and python 3.

We previously dropped the support of python 2.7 [2] and now we only support
python 3 so we don't need to continue to use this module and the imports
listed below.

Imports commonly used and their related PEPs:
- `division` is related to PEP 238 [3]
- `print_function` is related to PEP 3105 [4]
- `unicode_literals` is related to PEP 3112 [5]
- `with_statement` is related to PEP 343 [6]
- `absolute_import` is related to PEP 328 [7]

[1] https://docs.python.org/3/library/__future__.html
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html
[3] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0238
[4] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3105
[5] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3112
[6] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0343
[7] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0328

Change-Id: Icf8bd00b271f44b6bb0c932d6d49fe6de8a22537
"}]
commit_message:
Stop to use the __future__ module.

The __future__ module [1] was used in this context to ensure compatibility
between python 2 and python 3.

We previously dropped the support of python 2.7 [2] and now we only support
python 3 so we don't need to continue to use this module and the imports
listed below.

Imports commonly used and their related PEPs:
- `division` is related to PEP 238 [3]
- `print_function` is related to PEP 3105 [4]
- `unicode_literals` is related to PEP 3112 [5]
- `with_statement` is related to PEP 343 [6]
- `absolute_import` is related to PEP 328 [7]

[1] https://docs.python.org/3/library/__future__.html
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html
[3] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0238
[4] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3105
[5] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3112
[6] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0343
[7] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0328

Change-Id: Icf8bd00b271f44b6bb0c932d6d49fe6de8a22537

subject: Avoid unconditional fact gathering
messages: [{'account_id': 9061, 'date': '2020-06-02 14:09:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 167, 'date': '2020-06-02 14:50:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2020-06-04 09:42:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-06-02 14:09:28.000000000', 'message': "Avoid unconditional fact gathering

One way to improve the performance of Ansible is through fact caching.
Rather than gather facts in every play, we can configure Ansible to
cache them in a persistent store. An example Ansible configuration for
doing this is as follows:

[defaults]
gathering = smart
fact_caching = jsonfile
fact_caching_connection = ./facts
fact_caching_timeout = 86400

This does not affect Kolla Ansible however, since we use the setup
module which unconditionally gathers facts regardless of the state of
the cache. This gets worse with large inventories limited to a small
batch of hosts via --limit or serial, since the limited hosts must
gather facts for all others.

One way to detect whether facts exist for a host is via the
'module_setup' variable, which exists only when facts exist. This change
uses the 'module_setup' fact to determine whether facts need to be
gathered for hosts outside of the batch. For hosts in the batch, we
switch from using the setup module to gather_facts on the play, which
can use the 'smart' gathering logic.

Change-Id: I04841fb62b2e1d9e97ce4b75ce3a7349b9c74036
Partially-Implements: blueprint performance-improvements
(cherry picked from commit e0ba55a85d617c12f51be41c10778696ffc5004c)
"}]
commit_message:
Avoid unconditional fact gathering

One way to improve the performance of Ansible is through fact caching.
Rather than gather facts in every play, we can configure Ansible to
cache them in a persistent store. An example Ansible configuration for
doing this is as follows:

[defaults]
gathering = smart
fact_caching = jsonfile
fact_caching_connection = ./facts
fact_caching_timeout = 86400

This does not affect Kolla Ansible however, since we use the setup
module which unconditionally gathers facts regardless of the state of
the cache. This gets worse with large inventories limited to a small
batch of hosts via --limit or serial, since the limited hosts must
gather facts for all others.

One way to detect whether facts exist for a host is via the
'module_setup' variable, which exists only when facts exist. This change
uses the 'module_setup' fact to determine whether facts need to be
gathered for hosts outside of the batch. For hosts in the batch, we
switch from using the setup module to gather_facts on the play, which
can use the 'smart' gathering logic.

Change-Id: I04841fb62b2e1d9e97ce4b75ce3a7349b9c74036
Partially-Implements: blueprint performance-improvements
(cherry picked from commit e0ba55a85d617c12f51be41c10778696ffc5004c)

commit_message:
CI: reduce memory and disk for testing nodes

There is not reason to use 10 or 12G of disk for Cirros.

Also change the RAM to 512M, although we'll have to revert it back
on master and ussuri once we switch to DIB images by default.

Conflicts:
	scripts/test-bifrost.sh

Change-Id: Ibada78686ffb4db1d8dae05acf980081d5265fc6
(cherry picked from commit 85e1b8207885d64daf986158dba8768ae49b257e)

commit_message:
Add std-with-versions stable-branch-type

This adds a new std-with-versions branch type. This is used to control
validation logic when branching to allow the Ironic team to create
intermediary stable branches based on major.minor version numbers in
addition to our normal expected stable/$series branches.

https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/ironic-specs/specs/not-implemented/new-release-model.html

Change-Id: Ic482c77a2c177162ffe37643a455ac1724a658b3
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Clean up remainders of USE_SYSTEMD and logging setup

We dropped the ability to override USE_SYSTEMD to False when we deleted
screen support in [0], so we can also clean up any conditionals based
on it.

Also clean up the logging setup functions, dropping local vars for
parameters that we don't actually support anymore.

[0] I8c27182f60b0f5310b3a8bf5feb02beb7ffbb26a

Change-Id: I5cbce9f2c42e111761e8689447b3f8cbb7ea2eb5

commit_message:
Oslo releases for 2020-06-03

I'm not sure all of these strictly need to be released, but some of
the projects had quite a few patches piling up which makes it harder
to tell at a glance whether there are release-worthy patches. Things
like the doc requirements changes may be helpful for packagers too.

Change-Id: I21a5e8a7ca283f4739bf9ead31a66d54f3d7cf82

commit_message:
Simplify setting task "started_at" and "finished_at"

* Moving the responsibility to manage values of these timestamps
  into the method Task.set_state() so that this logic is now
  fully associated with how task execution state changes.

Change-Id: I13a5a5921dea06cee7f3efd53af5c327fe89a180

commit_message:
Ensure net.ipv6.conf.lo.disable_ipv6=0

Along the same lines as https://review.opendev.org/#/c/580460/.

Currently, the Erlang Port Mapper Daemon requires that the loopback
interface supports IPv6 in order to initialize properly.
Without that, rabbitmq-server cannot start and deployment fails at step 2.

Until the startup behaviour of epmd is amended, do not disable inet6 support
on loopback device to workaround the problem.

Change-Id: Ia747103aca99f3f45d7705248c6c1ef19aa93d71

commit_message:
Fix devstack default settings in aarch64

1. Lack qemu-efi in ubuntu
2. Lack edk2.git-aarch64 in Fedora/Centos
3. Remove NOVNC disable.

Change-Id: Ifbd0c386df6b28bc64cef20cab8e08f99a85c782
Signed-off-by: Kevin Zhao <kevin.zhao@linaro.org>

commit_message:
CI: raise DIB jobs memory to 3 GiB

The only reason the current 2 GiB nodes work is because DIB started
removing linux-firmware from its images. Unfortunately, we need this
package on bare metal, and readding it brings to 3 GiB consumption.

Change-Id: I2663bca37c87c09441621755639f4cebc7d2b0a5

commit_message:
Remove iDRAC Redfish boot device known issue

Since workaround is implemented in Redfish driver,
it works without setting force_persistent_boot_device to Never.

Change-Id: I5556e18f51e066f7acbf5332ca3a498140b0a7e2
(cherry picked from commit 4ae482897a5ad055233cbffe82c348f530da7dc0)

commit_message:
Stop to use the __future__ module.

The __future__ module [1] was used in this context to ensure compatibility
between python 2 and python 3.

We previously dropped the support of python 2.7 [2] and now we only support
python 3 so we don't need to continue to use this module and the imports
listed below.

Imports commonly used and their related PEPs:
- `division` is related to PEP 238 [3]
- `print_function` is related to PEP 3105 [4]
- `unicode_literals` is related to PEP 3112 [5]
- `with_statement` is related to PEP 343 [6]
- `absolute_import` is related to PEP 328 [7]

[1] https://docs.python.org/3/library/__future__.html
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html
[3] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0238
[4] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3105
[5] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3112
[6] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0343
[7] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0328

Change-Id: Ia60c23576e6a36634540032c83b38440de4771d8

[{'created': '2020-05-22 10:18:42.000000000', 'message': "Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 and reno 3.1.0 versions. Using
these versions will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Set openstackdocs_pdf_link to link to PDF file. Note that
the link to the published document only works on docs.openstack.org
where the PDF file is placed in the top-level html directory. The
site-preview places the PDF in a pdf directory.

Set openstackdocs_auto_name to use 'project' as name.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always
used 'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx'
can lead to some strange rendering.

Remove docs requirements from lower-constraints, they are not
needed during install or test but only for docs building.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the
renames before the next release removes them. A couple of variables
are also not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: Ie623e7a2389c292ffc71a285f0fc2d4bb9820c3f

commit_message:
Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 and reno 3.1.0 versions. Using
these versions will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Set openstackdocs_auto_name to use 'project' as name.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always
used 'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx'
can lead to some strange rendering.

Remove docs requirements from lower-constraints, they are not
needed during install or test but only for docs building.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the
renames before the next release removes them. A couple of variables
are also not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: Ie623e7a2389c292ffc71a285f0fc2d4bb9820c3f

After a bit of digging, I found that glance removed support for TLS termination: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/697969.

:('}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2020-04-16 13:44:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 28:

> After a bit of digging, I found that glance removed support for TLS
 > termination: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/697969.
 > 
 > :(

I spoke with jokke from Glance. He suggested using either HAProxy or (his preference) stunnel as a reverse proxy for glance. The issue with apache httpd & glance is apparently that during an image upload the request data (image) gets copied to /tmp, then is read by glance-api.'}, {'account_id': 30810, 'date': '2020-04-17 23:45:30.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 29.'}, {'account_id': 30810, 'date': '2020-04-17 23:49:21.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 30.'}, {'account_id': 30810, 'date': '2020-04-18 04:27:14.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 31.'}, {'account_id': 30810, 'date': '2020-04-18 23:33:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 31:

Still, it's a different file (client vs ssl). So it sounds like the part where stunnel talks with eventlet (glance) via simple tcp?"}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2020-04-23 19:54:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 37:

2019.12.09 21:21:06 LOG2[ui]: Double free attempt: ptr=0x7f48b000e680 alloc=client.c:1398 free#1=client.c:1410 free#2=ssl.c:117

that line is suspiciously similar though :-)'}, {'account_id': 22629, 'date': '2020-04-23 20:20:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 37:

 > that line is suspiciously similar though :-)

Maybe it's just version difference, and a bug on the Ubuntu version of the package?
A small off topic - I used Stunnel like over 15 years ago - I didn't think it's alive..."}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2020-04-24 07:31:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 37:

Maybe, but folks on Ubuntu side do not seem to care that much. We might have to look for alternatives which would be apache/nginx ssl proxy container. This might make sense in fact, future-wise."}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2020-04-24 07:32:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 37:

What is interesting though is that it seems to use TLSv1.3, I didn't know it was considered stable in bionic. That could be the clue here."}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2020-04-24 09:06:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 37:

It seems to be the same in CentOS 8 but that is at least expected. I would blame stunnel/OpenSSL (as stunnel should also be viewed as wrapper over OpenSSL) on Ubuntu to be doing something nasty with TLSv1.3'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2020-04-24 09:16:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 37:

So it seems Ubuntu did not update stunnel since original release (!). That does not sound fine AT ALL. At the same time they updated OpenSSL a few times, hence why it has TLSv1.3 which would normally be disco+. I wonder if they did not make stunnel broken by that. The referenced bug report is rather old and does not speak of TLSv1.3 because it was not around at the time but just about any bigger change to OpenSSL could possibly break stunnel if it is getting zero care along the way (assuming it did ever work at initial release).'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2020-04-24 09:39:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 37:

https://www.stunnel.org/NEWS.html

Version 5.45, 2018.05.21, urgency: MEDIUM
...
TLS 1.3 compliant session handling for OpenSSL 1.1.1.

vs

http://changelogs.ubuntu.com/changelogs/pool/universe/s/stunnel4/stunnel4_5.44-1ubuntu3/changelog

got ya!

Also this:

Version 5.49, 2018.09.03, urgency: MEDIUM
...
Fixed a crash in the session persistence implementation.

^ session persistence action is one of last logged things and it crashes so the original bug report is probably about this part, and ours about 1.3 as well.

Analysis done.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2020-06-04 09:48:00.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Implemented differently using haproxy.'}]

Add support for encrypting glance api

Add TLS support for glance api using stunnel to do TLS termination.

commit_message:
Improve Ansible version check error handling

* Run the Ansible version check after the kolla_ansible python import
  test. This should help with 'forgot to activate virtualenv' issues.
* Check for failure of ansible command when version checking, provide a
  different message.

Change-Id: I51984e96b44ced3c27f735341814c53a88b50fa5
Related: blueprint ansible-max-version

[{'created': '2020-04-23 21:29:06.000000000', 'message': 'Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/ussuri

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/ussuri branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Ifedeae4a7030e4a5cc7252883b1db51047d2f01e
'}]
commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/ussuri

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/ussuri branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Ifedeae4a7030e4a5cc7252883b1db51047d2f01e

commit_message:
Use tag for dib

Stable/train and older branches have py27 support, since diskimage-builder
removed the support we can't relly on the master branch. Let's use the
tag 2.38.0 since still provides py27 support.

Change-Id: I378510457650e1502fb4c30b13601b222b289825

[{'created': '2020-05-16 15:35:19.000000000', 'message': 'Switch to Monasca API for logs

The Monasca Log API has been removed and in this change we switch
to using the unified API. If dedicated log APIs are required then
this can be supported through configuration. Out of the box the
Monasca API is used for both logs and metrics which is envisaged to
work for most use cases.

In order to use the unified API for logs, we need to disable the
legacy Kafka client. We also rename the Monasca API config file
to remove a warning about using the old style name.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/728638

commit_message:
Switch to Monasca API for logs

The Monasca Log API has been removed and in this change we switch
to using the unified API. If dedicated log APIs are required then
this can be supported through configuration. Out of the box the
Monasca API is used for both logs and metrics which is envisaged to
work for most use cases.

In order to use the unified API for logs, we need to disable the
legacy Kafka client. We also rename the Monasca API config file
to remove a warning about using the old style name.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/728638
Change-Id: I9b6bf5b6690f4b4b3445e7d15a40e45dd42d2e84

[{'created': '2020-06-02 19:07:27.000000000', 'message': "Stop to use the __future__ module.

The __future__ module [1] was used in this context to ensure compatibility
between python 2 and python 3.

We previously dropped the support of python 2.7 [2] and now we only support
python 3 so we don't need to continue to use this module and the imports
listed below.

Imports commonly used and their related PEPs:
- `division` is related to PEP 238 [3]
- `print_function` is related to PEP 3105 [4]
- `unicode_literals` is related to PEP 3112 [5]
- `with_statement` is related to PEP 343 [6]
- `absolute_import` is related to PEP 328 [7]

[1] https://docs.python.org/3/library/__future__.html
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html
[3] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0238
[4] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3105
[5] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3112
[6] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0343
[7] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0328

Change-Id: Ifa2e16df273a2d272a6631a70ee94c76f8e3716e
"}]
commit_message:
Stop to use the __future__ module.

The __future__ module [1] was used in this context to ensure compatibility
between python 2 and python 3.

We previously dropped the support of python 2.7 [2] and now we only support
python 3 so we don't need to continue to use this module and the imports
listed below.

Imports commonly used and their related PEPs:
- `division` is related to PEP 238 [3]
- `print_function` is related to PEP 3105 [4]
- `unicode_literals` is related to PEP 3112 [5]
- `with_statement` is related to PEP 343 [6]
- `absolute_import` is related to PEP 328 [7]

[1] https://docs.python.org/3/library/__future__.html
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html
[3] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0238
[4] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3105
[5] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3112
[6] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0343
[7] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0328

Change-Id: Ifa2e16df273a2d272a6631a70ee94c76f8e3716e

commit_message:
Ensure allowed_cidrs field is present on older openstacksdk versions

As openstacksdk 0.36.0 is needed on lower-constraints and it
does not support allowed_cidrs field on the listener, we must
ensure that field is present to properly update the listeners ACLs.

Closes-bug: 1881914
Change-Id: I46d14e9088a0643ba02b0a7d4c8000fa2a22d379

[{'created': '2020-05-27 15:09:17.000000000', 'message': 'Ensure ipv6 loopback is alrways present for epmd

With the refactoring of kernel sysctl from puppet to ansible [1],
we lost a sysctl flag that is required to ensure that epmd can
start even when a host has IPv6 networking disabled globally [2].

Re-introduce the missing sysctl setting.

Closes-Bug: #1880967

[1] I30270943aa66a8a982657af3d7d59b8425534b0d
[2] I200acaeaca15e47dc2e3b2462a6254e85477ffb0

Change-Id: I9e666e905d00e8fc539abd2932d1463d1b1a74db
'}]
commit_message:
Ensure ipv6 loopback is alrways present for epmd

With the refactoring of kernel sysctl from puppet to ansible [1],
we lost a sysctl flag that is required to ensure that epmd can
start even when a host has IPv6 networking disabled globally [2].

Re-introduce the missing sysctl setting.

Closes-Bug: #1880967

[1] I30270943aa66a8a982657af3d7d59b8425534b0d
[2] I200acaeaca15e47dc2e3b2462a6254e85477ffb0

Change-Id: I9e666e905d00e8fc539abd2932d1463d1b1a74db

commit_message:
Cleanup docs building

This repo is now testing only with Python 3, so let's make
a few cleanups:
- Remove obsolete sections from setup.cfg
- Switch to using sphinx-build
- Remove install_command from tox.ini, the default is fine
- cleanup tox.ini
- Update pbr requirement

commit_message:
Switch to newer openstackdocstheme version

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 version. Using
this version will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Disable openstackdocs_auto_name to use 'project' variable as name.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: I9dbba04f3918ced819e9e69a58bc5e580ad5d538

commit_message:
Switch to newer openstackdocstheme version

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 version. Using
this version will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Disable openstackdocs_auto_name to use 'project' variable as name.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: I52f0ef0428168b2dcd75a32df1be2b455ee00d5d

commit_message:
Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 and reno 3.1.0 versions. Using
these versions will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Set openstackdocs_pdf_link to link to PDF file. Note that
the link to the published document only works on docs.openstack.org
where the PDF file is placed in the top-level html directory. The
site-preview places the PDF in a pdf directory.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: Ia41113e36cdf0c5a0821291494908070dd5f9138

commit_message:
Cleanup docs and py27 building

* Use sphinx-build to follow PTI
* Remove obsolete section from setup.cfg
* Cleanup tox.ini
* Update pbr requirement
* Fix build problems: Lexing of http failed.

commit_message:
CNF on Kubernetes cluster inside VM

This specification describes enhancement of
VNF Lifecycle Management for Container Network Function
on Kubernetes cluster in Virtual Machines.

The CNF instantiation/termination process will be splited into:
* VNF-A: VMs and set up Kubernetes cluster
* VNF-B: CNF on the Kubernetes cluster inside VNF-A

Blueprint: cnf-support-with-etsi-nfv-specs
Change-Id: I9013ca13fb5351b54ec8cf52e9475a3efdaaa0ea

commit_message:
Add TLS version configuration for pools

Add field tls_versions to pools for restricing TLS versions used.
This is a colon-separated string of versions to be used.
Available values (as defined in octavia-lib):
SSLv3, TLSv1, TLSv1.1, TLSv1.2, TLSv1.3

Add default_pool_tls_versions in octavia.conf

Note: TLSv1.3 connections will use haproxy's default ciphers
instead of the listener's tls_ciphers field

Change-Id: I480b7fb9756d98ba9dbcdfd1d4b193ce6868e291
Story: 2006733
Task: 37173
Depends-On: Ic33d9b9a256490ae1b048cdfd2475d6340509fdb

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 10273, 'date': '2020-05-01 21:20:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

(15 comments)

So we need to actually figure out how this is being represented on the user side, versus how it's being stored in the DB. I guess I vote we represent on the user side as an ACTUAL list, which means like `"tls_protocols": ["TLSv1.1", "TLSv1.2"]`, and then we can store that in the DB as a CSV list if we want to keep it simple... I commented in a bunch of places (similar to where Michael did) but there could be others that need to be updated to accomplish this (like, probably in the models for storage/retrieval)? Anywho... Thanks!'}, {'account_id': 31568, 'date': '2020-05-05 20:10:37.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 31568, 'date': '2020-05-05 20:15:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 31568, 'date': '2020-05-05 20:26:26.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 11628, 'date': '2020-05-06 22:15:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Patch Set 7 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 31568, 'date': '2020-05-10 08:03:21.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 11628, 'date': '2020-05-18 21:51:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Code-Review-1

(3 comments)

We need to add a validator to the API that checks for TLS version lists of [] and returns a 400 (Invalid) to the user.
For example, when I attempted to update a listener to [], the listener goes to error and the worker log shows:
May 18 14:43:11 devstack octavia-worker[10651]: ERROR octavia.amphorae.drivers.haproxy.exceptions [None req-ec63a4b6-6357-4b48-98cb-df982d123de4 None None] Amphora age
nt returned unexpected result code 400 with response {'message': 'Invalid request', 'details': "[ALERT] 138/214310 (1272) : Proxy '98175932-bffe-48d8-8ab9-18aa5965dd9d
': all SSL/TLS versions are disabled for bind '172.24.4.91:443' at [/var/lib/octavia/a116c96d-43fa-43bf-820c-b614cb3ef514/haproxy.cfg.new:23].\n[WARNING] 138/214310 (1
272) : Setting tune.ssl.default-dh-param to 1024 by default, if your workload permits it you should set it to at least 2048. Please set a value >= 1024 to make this wa
rning disappear.\n[ALERT] 138/214310 (1272) : Fatal errors found in configuration.\n"}'}, {'account_id': 11628, 'date': '2020-05-18 21:52:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9:

Just to clarify, when it's an HTTPS_terminated listener, the user should not be able to set the version list to []."}, {'account_id': 11628, 'date': '2020-05-18 23:33:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

The validator also needs to check that the items in the list are valid protocols.
I was able to use "TLSv1.0" which it accepts, returns in the UI, but the jinja does not reflect because it dosen't match octaiva-lib "TLSv1".'}, {'account_id': 31568, 'date': '2020-05-22 18:18:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-20 23:12:53.000000000', 'message': 'Add TLS version configuration for listeners

Add field tls_versions to listeners for restricting TLS versions used.
This is a colon-separated string of versions to be used.
Available values (as defined in octavia-lib):
SSLv3, TLSv1, TLSv1.1, TLSv1.2

Add default_listener_tls_versions in octavia.conf.

Although this does not explicitly include support for the TLSv1.3
option found in newer versions of haproxy (1.8-dev2+), TLSv1.3 will
always be used when it is available.  The restriction of TLS versions
is accomplished with flags that disable unused versions (no-sslv3,
no-tls10, etc.), so by not supporting the no-tlsv13 flag, TLSv1.3 will
always be enabled when present.

Change-Id: Ic33d9b9a256490ae1b048cdfd2475d6340509fdb
Story: 2006733
Task: 37170

commit_message:
Add TLS version configuration for listeners

Add field tls_versions to listeners for restricting TLS versions used.
This is a list of versions to be used.
Available values (as defined in octavia-lib):
SSLv3, TLSv1, TLSv1.1, TLSv1.2, TLSv1.3

Add default_listener_tls_versions in octavia.conf.

Note that at this time TLS 1.3 ciphersuites are not impelemented,
so any TLS 1.3 connections will use haproxy's default ciphers
instead of what's specified by tls_ciphers.

Change-Id: Ic33d9b9a256490ae1b048cdfd2475d6340509fdb
Story: 2006733
Task: 37170
Task: 37169

subject: Change method name is_service_down to is_service_disabled

[{'created': '2020-06-04 06:04:54.000000000', 'message': 'Change method name is_service_down to is_service_disabled

In masakari/compute/nova.py, the method is_service_down checks whether service
status is enabled or not, rather than service up or down, so we fix it
first.

Change-Id: I030b8db9a6fa6db7b59aae2dcbfac224dfe493c8
Closes-Bug: #1882005
'}]
commit_message:
Change method name is_service_down to is_service_disabled

In masakari/compute/nova.py, the method is_service_down checks whether service
status is enabled or not, rather than service up or down, so we fix it
first.

Change-Id: I030b8db9a6fa6db7b59aae2dcbfac224dfe493c8
Closes-Bug: #1882005
